Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Staff :)”
Reviews.Author: pinkba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Pros: Excellent Location, lovely staff, Excellent Atmosphere and Decoration of the common areas. Cons: WiFi is only available in the Lobby; no WiFi inside your room. The AC in my room wasn't working, luckily it wasnt very hot but i can't imagine staying there during July or August without AC. And another disappointing feature was the breakfast. We payed the "breakfast included rate" but it was just coffee, juice and toast.. I would recommend the hotel, and definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: patrosolt
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel, excellent position, clean, quieter, the price are good, the garden is beautiful and the staff are excellent. Good option.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected !”
Reviews.Author: jppp69
Reviews.Content: Good average small hotel with need of refurbishment. Excellent all reception staff , very helpful and genuine , well informed about the area. Staff were always welcoming and makes you feel special (special thanks to Jesus Mario and Erick). 5 out of 5 . We did have an issue with the spa but we had a quick answer with alternative given. Room nicely cleaned everyday with fresh towels nicely decorated like animals , I asked the room aid if she could do a turtle with the towels and she did. Thanks again to Mario to arrange a lovely surprising deco in my bedroom for my birthday. Those little things will make me coming back again in the future. Muitas Gracias, Chin chin ;)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Yuccavalley
Reviews.Content: We had a great week staying here. The room was simple but totally functional for our basic needs of a clean, quiet and safe place. It's off the main strip which was to our liking. The main strip in Playa is really touristic and noisy, so staying a couple blocks away meant we still had easy access to the beach and all amenities but could get away from the crowds to relax and sleep. We could still just barely hear one of the clubs pounding until late at night, but not so much that it disturbed sleep. Any closer to 5th and I could see that being a problem. The folks at the desk were incredibly sweet and had a few good tips on how to get around. Overall, we recommend it and would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful jungle retreat”
Reviews.Author: Ryanandkatefulton
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at playa del karma and it was great to be away from the noises of the main street, but close enough to walk to it if we wanted. Restaurants and shops a few streets away. Our room was clean and beautifully decorated when we checked in, no tv, but you dont need it with so much to do in PDC. Great value, great price we will reccomend! Ps the pool is very cute.. But you have the caribbean sea a few block away so no need to Swim in it! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DrunkLove
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 nights based on excellent reviews on TripAdvisor but were quite disappointed. The hotel was pretty cheap and seemed in a fairly good location (on 10th Avenue, only 2 roads back from the beach) so I guess we shouldn't have been surprised that the room facilities were pretty basic. No TV, no iron, no kettle, no breakfast, awful tacky bathroom with missing lights, a rickety noisy old air-con (which at least worked, thank god), an air of mustiness and a tiny "pool" that was more a breeding ground for the mosquitoes infesting our room. On the positive side, the staff seemed fairly friendly, and at least it gave us an excuse to avoid going back to the room, and spending more time relaxing on the beach! Sadly, would not stay here again. (PS. Tip for visitors to Playa del Carmen: The acrobatic and cabaret show at Coco Bongo club around the corner is awesome and well worth the 55 dollars - go see it!)

Reviews.Title: “Almost ruined our honeymoon, beware Room #14”
Reviews.Author: spk999
Reviews.Content: It's taken me a while to write this review, only because it ruins my mood to remember our time at this hotel. I will try to keep it as short as possible... let's just say, we learned some spanish while staying at Playa del Karma. Beechus (bugs), in our kama (bed), and Manchas (stains) on our Sabanas (sheets)! We stayed here towards the end of Dec. Peak season in PDC so most hotels were fully booked. As it was our first time in Mexico, we shrugged off the initial bites on day one, assuming they were from the pesky mosquitoes. But by midnight on Day 2, we realized we were literally being bitten alive by tiny bugs in our bed. Realizing we hadn't been bitten once during the day, but only at night, we inspected the sheets and discovered tiny bugs at the bottom of the mattress (which had a rip in it). After alerting the front desk the next morning, we were promised a new mattress and that things would get better. We decided to hope for the best and tried to enjoy the rest of our stay. Day 3 - with much trepidation, we head to bed. For a honeymooning couple, it's sad that the bed was the last place we wanted to be!! By 4am we were itching and scratching our poor ankles again, and this time we decided to take pictures of everything. From the ant nests on the walls, in the bathrooms and the bedroom, to the little white ants crawling all over the sink and the bedside tables!! We inspected the mattress, and as we had suspected, they hadn't changed it as promised, but simply flipped it so we would think it was a new one. The rip was still there. By day 4 - we were getting desperate. The Manager was never seen or heard from. We were promised another room, if/when it would become available. FINALLY we got one. A much nicer one, with no beechus. But this time, I had to inspect the sheets as we had become experts after reading bed bug forums on my hubby's iPhone at 5am!! *Yikes* tiny blood stains - indication of tiny bugs that have died there. Pulled the covers back further - and there was a MASSIVE yellow stain. I could keep going on and on, but finally we got the sheets changed and had our FIRST full night's rest. Luckily, the days were super and PDC did not disappoint in any other way. We were also able to find another hotel closeby (Mosquito Beach - ironic?) that we fell in love with and were able to book a last minute room on Expedia for the remainder of our stay. Looking back, all would have been well if we hadn't gotten Room 14! The hotel itself is in an awesome location. Close to Avenue 5 + local haunts and activities. It's been done really nicely, with lots of palm trees and greenery. There's a little pool, full of bugs floating in it, which adds more ambiance than encouragement to swim! Luckily they have free passes to use Mamitas, which we thought was fantastic (despite having to fight for beach chairs and umbrellas if you get down there past 10am) until we tried the Mosquito Beach club! Little did we know such luxury could exist just a block down the beach!!! *sigh* My mistake for booking a more rustic hotel, rather than a luxury one for our honeymoon. Everything would have been fine, had the Management actually been around to handle things. Poor Mario did his best. But it just wasn't good enough. The lady Manager was extremely rude and refused to believe us, until we showed her our documented proof in photos and videos we had taken over the past 4 days of hell. Despite all this, she took no responsibility and never apologized for ruining our vacation. Just barked at us asking - "well what do you want?" - like a discount could make things better. I was sad to have to leave on a sour note. We refused to pay for the nights we were in Rm 14 and luckily we had not prepaid on our first day because their credit card machine had been down. There;s no way she would have ever refunded us our money!! Believe me, this is shorter than everything else I would like to add, but I hope no one goes through what we did. It seems like all the other rooms were fine. Just make sure you don't prepay until you've seen the room & checked the sheets. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Most Friendly Staff...disappointing room.”
Reviews.Author: JimDJohnsonIII
Reviews.Content: This will be a tough review to write because I liked the staff so much at Playa Del Karma that I want to give them a great review; however, the room accommodations were less than I expected and I feel obligated to call out my concerns. Let me begin with the positives: * The staff at Playa Del Karma are wonderful. I would like to give special thanks to Erick and Mario. They both went out of their way to be helpful and always kind. Thank you both very much. Honestly, I cannot praise the staff enough. * Second positive is the tropical courtyard - very nice. * Third positive was use of Mamitas Beach Club - very enjoyable each day we went. As far as the negatives, we were very disappointed in the rooms. I paid the higher price for a Karma Room expecting a nice, clean, and comfortable space. This was not the case. We were first placed in room 14. It was dark with very poor lighting. The room had a very musty smell and our greatest concern was that there was mold visible through the paint at the bottom of the bathroom floor as well as the bottom of one of the wall floors. After 2 nights in this room, we could no longer tolerate the musty smell and requested to be moved. Mario was very gracious in getting us moved to room 23. This room was certainly better than room 14; however, it simply was not what we had expected from the pictures on the website. Playa Del Karma certainly has a charm about it; however, I would recommend they look into the room concerns I have expressed. If these issues were corrected, I think it would make for a more pleasant stay for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice local touch, unbelievable hospitality”
Reviews.Author: drudle
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Playa del Carmen was a very "spur of the moment" thing. We didn't want to stay in Cancun with all the resorts and golfers, we wanted a more unique and local experience. This hotel provided that perfect charm and a live easy atmosphere. The moment we walked in the lobby we knew it was perfect. The one complaint I have is that the staff could not always recommend good activities or places to go to in the area. (Thats all right there wifi worked fine and trip advisor could suffice) Can't wait to return in march! Thanks for the great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Joeylf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location on a quiet street. It's an easy 2 block walk to Quinta Avenida. The infamous Coco Bongo is only block away, and I could hear it's thumping music late at night if I listened hard. The room was cute and comfortable. The bed was very hard (not a problem). Wifi worked in our room, and the air conditioner was efficient. At $50 a night, my husband and I thought it was a great value for the two nights we were here. The little atrium courtyard is very cute, but I never had the opportunity to relax and enjoy it in the mornings as hoped because it was filled with maintenance and renovation crew. Not exactly private and quiet, and they made me feel unwelcome. We were woken very early our first morning there by very noisy construction in the room next to ours. If I ever return to Playa del Carmen, I'd definitely consider staying here again (as long as they promised not to wake me early with loud power tools!).

Reviews.Title: “Sweet atmospheric small hotel in a tropical garden”
Reviews.Author: walkfootman
Reviews.Content: Lets get the basics out of the way. My beautifully decorated air conditioned room was spotlessly clean. My king size bed was well appointed and wonderfully comfortable. Attractive bathroom. Reading lights on each side of the bed (thank you! -- you know, that's one of my major complaints about budget hotels in Mexico) Plenty of warm water for a shower. Best of all, I had a little veranda outside my room with a hammock, a few chairs and a little table. What fun to catch up on my emails with perfect wi-fi reception throughout the property. The hotel rooms are woven throughout a well established tropical garden in this little nook about 4 blocks from the beach and 5th Avenue. It's just a couple of blocks from the "other" ADO bus terminal, where you can catch a $10 transfer tot he Cancun airport. (the main ADO terminal in Playa is just a little further south near the ferry to Cozumel.

Reviews.Title: “quiet little gem tucked in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Daniel H
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel playa del karma back in 2009 with my girlfriend; I forgot to write a review after returning home (sorry, guys!), but it's a testament to the quality of experience I had there that even now, several years later, it's still something I remember fondly. This hotel is a wonderfully quiet oasis of calm in the hubbub of playa del carmen; if you like the idea of spending long days on the town, on the beach, or traveling, and then having a quiet little piece of tranquility to return to, this place is perfect. Nice, romantic, little rooms with a beautifully picturesque central courtyard / walkway. However, the biggest draw is the staff: friendly, personable, courteous, helpful. Every time we walked in the front lobby, we felt much more intimately welcomed than one would associate with simply checking into a hotel. I can't suggest this place highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “So peaceful and so near to all entertainments!”
Reviews.Author: MsL83
Reviews.Content: Really quiet place: you can rest inside and outside the room under the trees. The rooms are clean and the people are very kind and friendly. And the places where you can shop or have fun are really near!

Reviews.Title: “Mid-priced hotel away from the commotion of 10 Avenida”
Reviews.Author: uwsudz
Reviews.Content: Quiet, well kept little hotel. Not luxurious, but by no means cheap feeling. If you're coming from the airport, make sure you have the address handy because your cab driver will not necessary know of this hotel and it is not the easiest to spot (hint: look up high for the sign). Swimming pool is tiny, but good for an afternoon dip. Doesn't matter because beach is 5 minute walk. Staff is super friendly and will do what they can to accommodate your needs. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent!”
Reviews.Author: corredor55
Reviews.Content: This is a small, wonderful hotel. The staff is probably one of the best I've encountered in Mexico. It is only a few blocks from everything, but so quiet at night for sleeping. It is clean, comfortable and friendly. Ask for Erick the daytime manager. He goes out of his way to make your stay pleasant...and I will stay here again. Bill-Lexington, KY

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but did the job”
Reviews.Author: Wilp33
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night on our way to Cozumel. It is a basic hotel but service is excellent, they have free purified water and tea and internet at reception, and we loved lounging in the hammock on patio and comfy poolside furniture. The hotel is eally quiet day and night and is just one block from Ado bus station and from 5th Ave shopping and eating. The only feedback we have would be that we had no hot water (not a big deal for just one day) and the pool was quite dirty so we could not take a dip. Would stay here again though if passing through nut long term stays I am sure there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Playa Del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: BenG_123
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights in March 2011. It was our first trip to Playa Del Carmen, and I must say that this hotel proved to be an exceptional value. Being students, we were on a fairly tight budget and the price we payed through a package deal with flight on Expedia was very reasonable. We also opted for transportation to and from the airport through expedia ($40 per person roundtrip) and that worked out very well. The hotel itself has a unique charm to it with an open common area in the middle of the hotel that was perfect for relaxing with a book &/or cervesa, the rooms were very clean (daily), nice/large shower. The room had a fan which we used daily and an air conditioner which we never had to turn on. WiFi was strong as we were in a room towards the back and had no problem watching streamed movies. The staff was exceptional! Both of the hotel's primary attendants went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable and you could tell that they really cared about their guests and their hotel's reputation. Examples: We were going to do the Chichen Itza trip at $99 per person through the sightseeing companies (could be $22 using public transport - but no guide - which we wanted) - the hotel informed us of a deal they worked out to offer this same guided trip - with a buffet and extra stops at a cool Cenote (Underground river...bring your swim suit) and Valadolid (neat Mexican city) included in a $50 per person ticket....GREAT DEAL! Also, we decided last minute that we wanted to do a snorkeling trip - Stephania contacted the company to lock in our places and even walked us to the pick up location a few blocks away (we had to walk since we were late additions) to make sure we got on ok. Location is excellent - just a couple blocks and you are in the middle of the tourist area and four blocks to the beach. I prefer not to be right in the middle of the loud tourist area where bars/clubs are open really late. Convenience store (OXOX) on the next block towards the ocean where you can buy snacks & beach goodies (including a cooler). We had a great time and would definitely stay at Play Del Karma again next time we go to Playa Del Carmen and would recommend to any other traveler looking for an alternative to the mega resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location right near 5th Ave and the beach, yet tucked 2 blocks away for peaceful sleeping”
Reviews.Author: emg43
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Playa del Karma was the location - it was a 1 minute walk to 5th ave and the beach, but by being off 5th made a big difference as it wasn't busy or noisy around the hotel and we slept peacefully and comfortably. The room was a decent size, big comfortable bed, good TV and cupboard space, and a clean and decent bathroom. We particularly loved coming home to the towel creations left by the cleaners. The staff were useful and friendly, but our only criticism was that they weren't upfront about some of the benefits included in our room fee. We had to enquire about our free beach club passes, breakfast and the code to the internet - none of this information was mentioned to us in advance as if they were hoping we wouldn't bring it up.. But, once we did the staff were very helpful and always smiling and polite. The laundromat next door was also very handy, as was the free internet, and all in all we were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, quiet and clean. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: longlakehouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Playa del Karma after stopping in with no reservations. We were so happy with the room that was available, a king size bed with new linens and beautifully decorated. The hotel is a thatch roof style surrounded by lovely plants and trees. The swimming pool was a bit small but okay to cool off. The location was only about 5 minutes from the beach and many restaurants and shops within walking distance. The hotel staff was so helpful and the price was perfect for our budget. We would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in service with reservations...”
Reviews.Author: tripsfromaustin
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, my husband and I were told due to the issues in Egypt (we're guessing influx of tourists???-no further explanation was given) we had been moved to the sister hotel, Alux. The Alux, while clean and quiet (other than VERY thin walls) was not what we had hoped or paid for in the comfort department. We were given a discount of $10USD, yet the deposit we paid a month prior was not refunded, therefore, we paid the same as we would have at the nicer place, Playa del Karma. We were only there for one night, so it wasn't so horrible...but lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pinnnnnnk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value, the service is very friendly, the inner courtyard with small pool and lights strung across palm trees is a lovely oasis, and the rooms are clean and equipped with AC, tv and small deposit box. There was a high vaulted thatched roof which made the room feel airy but unfortunately not too sound proof. Right across from the new ADO bus station so a good place to stay if you are catching an early morning bus from the station. Just a couple blocks from 5th ave where all the action happens at Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, helpful staff, steps to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Andrei_ordine
Reviews.Content: Located steps away from the ocean, but also close to the supermarkets. "Low-rise" hotel with original and artsy interiors, and a palm-leaf roof that keeps the air inside cool. We never had to run the air conditioner. Very helpful staff - let us use their fridge to store some queso, gave directions and ideas for day trips.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to details, kind service, laid back”
Reviews.Author: DVandMA
Reviews.Content: I meant to write this review right after our trip but life took over. After almost a year I remember vividly the sweet 4 nights we spent at Karma. The night I was checking in the lovely woman at the front desk noticed it was my birthday that day. The following morning we were brought a birthday dessert at our breakfast (breakfast included; a varied buffet, great eggs daily, cereals, fresh fruit). And upon returning to our room, we found it decorated with birthday wishes. This is a quiet, clean, affordable and safe little hotel with a peaceful atmosphere. After a day at the beach you can read in the treed courtyard or rest on a hammock in the shaded porch. We would definitely return to Karma!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for price!”
Reviews.Author: writejerome
Reviews.Content: Playa Del Karma is situated less than a 5 minute walk to the center of town, nearby 30th Ave where all the locals hang out and to 5th Avenue where all the tourists hangout. A western style laundromat (washer/dryer), which is not ran by PDK, is right next door making it even more convenient. Also within a 5 minute walk is Wal-Mart, Mega (another big but local grocery store chain), the ADO #2 terminal bus station, and a comfortable 10 minute walk from ADO #1 terminal bus station. If you take ADO from Cancun airport to PDC, ADO terminal #1 is where the bus will drop you off. Primarily relying on public transportation to get around was another plus to my experience staying here. But in the midst of the hustle and bustle, PDK still provided much needed privacy and comfort. The hammock outside my room was great! PDK was perfect for me as I took the bus to Chichen Itza, and Vallodolid, and the collectivo to XCaret. They also had a computer with free access to a speedy connection to the internet. Every day upon my return, I'd find a lovely animal shaped towel welcoming me back. This simple detail brought so much comfort and warmth. The Nativo room, which I chose, had a very clean and comfortable king size bed, a ceiling fan, an A/C unit. a personal safe, and a working hot/cold shower. After the first day, I just used the ceiling fan. It' is a comfortable stroll away from the ferry to Cozumel and the beach itself. The staff was very helpful in answering my questions about places to go and see and was more than willing to provide suggestions on local things to do. They made me feel very comfortable every time I asked questions. PDK also offer massages, bike rentals and other amenities. Like a small fridge for my room which I did not need but will get the next time I stay there longer. One more thing, since a church is very close, there are times when the bell can be a surprise but it never rang past 8 pm or too early to bother me. I hope to stay here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, authentic feel, quaint”
Reviews.Author: MLPudlak
Reviews.Content: Playa Del Karma was a fantastic little hotel. Now this isnt the hotel looking for luxury by any means but its got so much charm! The courtyard was lush with trees and plants, each room had a hammock on the porch and the roof inside the room was thatched. ( A note about the roof, we kept hearing a I hear a weird noise coming from the roof and figured out it was a gecko-or several of them) They also had this small cool wrap around pool. As for location, it is only blocks from the touristy strip and the beaches. Breakfast was the usual bread, jam and juice. The staff was super friendly and we had a great time :)

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: BethanyNOLA
Reviews.Content: Our favorite thing about this hotel is the amazing jungle courtyard filled with tropical foliage and palm trees. We spent countless hours using the free WiFi in the courtyard and swimming in the small but refreshing pool. There was a new addition of a massage hut by the pool that would have made a very relaxing place to let your stress melt away. Our room was fabulous, and that may be because we think that we had the best room in the house. Ask for room 15 (III in Maya) if you are a couple looking for a king size bed. The room was clean, included a flat screen TV with cable, and a small table and chairs for enjoying drinks. The staff even lent us a cooler to use. They were building a restaurant bar during our stay, so they might not let you do that again. The bathroom included a big shower however the water wasn’t as hot as I thought it could be. They do however include organic shampoo, soap and conditioner as the complimentary samples. The staff was wonderful. David helped us find great places to eat and offered terrific customer service. He gave us discount passes to Las Mamitas Beach Club which is a MUST. Our discount included an umbrella and two lounge chairs for $7 for the day. The hotel gives guests beach towels to use as well. A complimentary computer is available in the lobby. We took advantage of low season prices and paid $50 usd for a double to stay during the first week of September. This did not include breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND SERVICE LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: runner7710
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wento to this hotel not knowing what to expect, we loved it. The staff were very helpful, the rooms clean and tidy, the location could not have been any better, so peaceful. If you are looking for that small peaceful place then this is it!!! We could not fault it in any way. If you are looking for the all inclusive, large hotel etc. this hotel is not for you. It is really just like being in paradise!!!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT FOR US”
Reviews.Author: Mango_con_Leche
Reviews.Content: I went to Mexico with a friend of mine on a dive trip. We were going to spend most of our money and time diving, so we just wanted a cheap place to stay that was centrally located but not so in the middle of things that we'd be kept up with all the noice from the late night parties. This was perfect. We were 2 blocks from 5th ave (the main strip). We were just a coupl of blocks from the dive shop, not too far of a walk to the ferry to cozumel, but we were just out of ear shot of Coco Bongo. The place felt very safe and the rooms were clean, with daily maid service. The staff was very friendly; however, do your research before hand to determine what activities you want to do (because none of them had any suggestions other than just lying on the beach) and where you want to eat (because they only seemed to recommend places for which they had coupons to give you).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: AndreaWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely place. The rooms are beautifully decorated in Mexican style. The beds are very comfortable. The rooms are clean and the shower is hot. The courtyard is pleasant and WiFi works throughout it. They also have a computer in the lobby for guests to use. The hotel is very quiet (even though it is only two blocks from 5th avenue). The walk to the beach is easy. All of the receptionist's restaurant recommendations were great. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Owners”
Reviews.Author: wheretoworld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful honeymoon stay there. Our room is placed such that it is very private and tranquil. The housekeeper would create fun little animals with our towels and place it on our bed - a very small thing I know but it made us chuckle when we walked into the room. The location is fabulous- very close to the beach but quiet away from the noise. The bus station is extremely close so we were fearful that it may not be a very nice place but we were very wrong. And we had everything that we needed in the room and everything worked. As the title states, it was the staff that made our stay memorable. And something that's unheard of - the owner even gave us a lift to the collectivo at the end of our stay! You won't find that anywhere folks and for me service is everything. A couple of things they will want to look into: 1) we also never got wireless connection from our room 2) breakfast? somehow we missed that altogether from reading recent postings but we never knew it was part of it so it wasn't missed or expected. All in all, I wouldn't hesitate to highly recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: NYCnana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great as long as you keep in mind that it’s extremely cheap and that you should not expect much from it. The hotel is small - all it has is about 17 rooms, a small pool, a small breakfast area, and the lobby. The rooms are dark and very basic (it’s just the bed/s, bathroom and a TV - some don't even have a TV). Don't expect any sort of view- the hotel is located far from the beach. It can get really hot (especially at the lobby), so make sure to keep your air conditioning on all day. The pool is extremely small and has lots of leaves, which makes it look a little dirty. Also, there's isn’t really a nice area where you can sit by the pool and relax. The breakfast they offer is bread, orange juice, coffee, and cereal. There isn’t anything else. Accordingly, it is very cheap and could be good if you are not very hungry. Otherwise, you can find nicer places where to have breakfast just a few blocks from the hotel. The real standout of Playa del Karma is the staff. They really were outstanding: Very polite and always willing to help. They truly will make you feel at home and very welcome. The hotel is also just 2 blocks from the area in Playa del Carmen where all the bars and restaurants and shops are located. so if you don’t mind not being directly on the beach, the location is excellent. A few additional comments: - The wireless did not work during my entire stay. However, there's a computer at the lobby that you can use free of charge. - No hairdryers, ladies- so bring your own! - Stay away from the rooms with the hay roofs! My friends stayed in one and lizards would fall on their bed in the middle of the night! Also, they could hear animals moving on the roof -very uncomfortable. My room had a regular roof and I did not have any issues with animals or bugs, so please request to be moved to a room with a regular roof if you get one of the other ones! - There is a lid on the shower that keeps bugs from creeping inside the room. However, when you shower, please be sure to pull the lid out so the water can go inside! I heard of a couple's room that flooded because they forgot to do this! - I would never pay more than 80/night to stay at this hotel. If what you are looking for is just a bed to sleep on…. if you are not planning on spending much time at the hotel… and if want to be close to Playa del Carmen town but don't want to spend a lot of money, then this is the place for you. BUT if what you are looking for is for a nice, relaxing, memorable, or romantic hotel then please spend a little more money and go somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value in great location”
Reviews.Author: richchstr
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, 18 rooms. Very clean, quiet, close to everything. Victor and David go above and beyond to insure a comfortable stay. Will definitly return

Reviews.Title: “Quaint quiet but close to town and lots of activity”
Reviews.Author: sherrylsells
Reviews.Content: There is not a bar at the hotel so that kept things pretty relaxing. We were very close to everything. felt very safe and saw many single toursit women walking on the streets so felt the area was safe. david was very nice and the entire staff was accomodating. i had a rental car and parking was within a block everytime i needed a space. its not a plush ritzy hotel its a very neat tropical place to stay. The computer was accessible and i paid the % for a refriderrator in the room which we used.

Reviews.Title: “great service and great value”
Reviews.Author: chloeb29
Reviews.Content: we originally booked 4 nights at this hotel and extended it to 6 after we were so impressed by the hotel staff and atmosphere. we especially appreciated the towels folded into cute animals each day.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and quiet place in the very heart of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: uspedi
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 night in 'Playa del Karma' no matter we planned only couple of them. This is a small hotel but with its own charming swimming pool. We have hammock and garden chairs for our own use. We were granted free water, tea, coffee. The rooms are clean. The most valuable was lovely multi-lingual staff that made our stay very peaceful. However this is not a seaside hotel, location is very good (just a block or a couple of blocks from beach access, supermarkets, bus station, 5th Avenida with its shops, restaurants and music clubs). We highly recommend 'Playa del Karma' as highest quality at reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it it was nice, romantic, very clean, and friendly but quiet and peacefull”
Reviews.Author: HildaPBGM
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel,,, close enough to the main street to get walk there quikly but far enough not to be hassled by noise and drunken teenagers on holiday... Romantic, not to crowded so your able to have some space and relax in the afternoon in the lovely pool... the staff are quite friendly and service oriented but not anoying and in your face... I'm going back there soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a tropical oasis”
Reviews.Author: Mumbultjari
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Close to the main 5th avenue but it is not too noisy and it is away from the resort area. The staff at this hotel are fantastic. The only thing is that breakfast is served about a 5 minute walk away but the breakfast is definitely worth it! You can also organise tours to Tulum or Cozumel from the hotel and there is free internet and filtered water in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Karmatronic”
Reviews.Author: pope_jp25
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was small and personal without being understaffed. Beautiful courtyard, blocks from the bus station and beach!!! Great for people passing through or for someone looking to relax for weeks.

Reviews.Title: “the location is bad !!!!”
Reviews.Author: js1975ny
Reviews.Content: the location is bad, but the staff was super nice and the place clean and with a friendly atmosphere. it is not on the beach, and playa del carmen is not a beautiful place at all, but the people working in this small hotel are doing a great job !!! if you want a beautiful beach go somewhere else, but if you want nightlife this is the place !!!

Reviews.Title: “Above & beyond your expectatios!!!”
Reviews.Author: Veronica_E
Reviews.Content: Playa del Karma is a boutique hotel with a state of the art service! I've stayed in this hotel several times, it became my favorite hotel after the very first time. The hotel is small but beutiful and enchanting, the vibe is great, I love the fact that is an adult only hotel. I't's great location and confortness gives you best of both worlds, you're five minutes form the great atmosphere of 5th ave, the main street, and at the same time once you're in there you get the feeling of being far away ofrom everything, the only noise you will probably hear is the waterfall in tha pool, It's the perfect retreat for couples or friends. The staff is very friendly and they offer the best service guaranteed! They make you feel as confortable as home! Breakfast is included in the morning and is great!, Tehy also offer spa services and oh my God you will love them!!! You won't regret your staing in this hotel!!! I hope you enjoy it as much as I do!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Play Del Karma truly lives up to it's name”
Reviews.Author: farfrob
Reviews.Content: a beautiful, charming hotel tucked away from the crazziness that is Play Del Carmen nice big rooms, totally affordable, free Wifi, swimming pool very friendly staff serene, peaceful, my room even had a hammock out in the patio loved it! birds chrping away in the morning, tall gorgeous trees a true gem !

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and lovely hotel in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: MS-SS-2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Playa del Karma for two weeks and we had a wonderfull time there. It started with checking in, that was very personal and we immediately felt very welcome. It's a small hotel with very charming and cozy rooms. We had a nice cabin with a palmtree roof, a small terrace with a hammock. The room was beautiful with a nice bathroom, and it was all very clean. We experienced the hotel as a small, quiet and relaxing place. It's like a little jungle in the middle of a busy Playa del Carmen, because they have a beautiful green garden surrounded by the cabins. The hotel is just two streets away from the main street of Playa del Carmen and just 3 minutes walk to the beach. We loved our stay in this gorgeous hotel very much and we recommend it to everywone who is looking for a lovely time in Playa del Carmen and who wants to avoid the big and commercial all-in resorts.

Reviews.Title: “A unique vacation in a place with lots of personality”
Reviews.Author: KasSicily
Reviews.Content: I truly wanted to write a review as soon as we returned home but the commitments actually never allowed me to fully dedicate a few words for them. The level of comfort, staff professionalism, courtesy and friendliness, delicious breakfast etc.. all were better than expected! I trusted tripadvisor when We planned our vacation and was surprised that all those previous reviews were exactly right. We had indeed found the best hotel there was! We even decided to stay a bit longer than originally planned because of what a great time we were having but they were fully booked. We went down to Tulum and quickly learned that that an All Inclusive vacation was not at all for us and that the calmness and personal care at Playa del Karma was definitely far better than the all Inclusive where we stayed. Eventually we went back to Playa del karma and checked in to another Nativo room. I must say that we thoroughly enjoyed both rooms. The quietness of the garden space with the small pool, the cascade, the temazcal steam bath and the singing birds was just an experience for the 2 of us. Also, the hotel is very close to everything that if you want restaurants, bars, etc... We definitely recommend Playa del karma. ( Kasandra&Carlos)

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Getaway, One Problem... :)”
Reviews.Author: Jsantana23
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay this past week. It was just as we thought reading from the reviews. The staff was great, especially Luis he answered all our questions and made sure everything was fine. We went to the breakfast the hotel offered which was better than we thought, so that was a plus. Some people said the location was way out there but we thought it could not have been any better. Just 5 minutes from 5th ave and 8 min from the beach it was in the perfect spot. The one bad thing about the place was the Mosquito's and bug problems. We were there for 7 days and did not notice until about our 3rd but we left with numerous bug bites and we even had to purchase some bug spray at the local Walmart ourselves which sucked. That was really the only problem we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Agree it is beautiful !! Little oasis in the city.”
Reviews.Author: Happyone69
Reviews.Content: Stayed 13 nights. Family of 4. 2 boys 11 and 13 yrs old. Very small quiet hotel. Great price, tasty breakfast, short walk to sister resort, beach and awesome resturants on 30th ave. Very friendly and welcoming staff. Would highly recommend for someone looking for value, but close to everything. Really appreciated the king size bed, loft with twin beds, oversize bathroom, towel animals, and lush gardens. Would have like pools to be warmer, less travelers that smoked, maybe few more lounge chairs near the pool. Loved the free wi fi and use of internet in the lobby and also the free water and coffee. It was a great 13 nights!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Private”
Reviews.Author: 1GlobalView
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and very private. It's only a block or 2 from the and 3 blocks from the beach. The grounds are absolutely amazing! It is a little retreat in itself. If you're lazy it might be a poor location, but if you don't mind walking a few blocks it is an EXCELLENT way to see Playa Del Carmen and say hi to the very friendly locals. The temescal was an interesting experience, but a bit over-priced in my opinion. Just make sure you take a taxi to the pier and catch the ferry to Cozumel... Be sure to go on a Sunday when there are no cruise ships! I would also suggest Xel-Ha versus the other eco-park and definitely snorkel the cenotes!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but most serviceable”
Reviews.Author: advocateonwheels
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel, almost a motel style place, with the friendliest staff. It is on a rather busy street but in Playa del Carmen all the streets are busy unless you can afford a villa in Playacar. The busy city life for me is part of the charm of Playa del Carmen. Our room was really basic but the bed was comfortable and the street noise and discos were pretty well muffled. It had a small porch with a hammock and two chairs. There is a small lap pool and a very well planted courtyard. There is a laid back live and let live vibe. The staff is very very nice. The desk person kept getting up to hold the door for us which was not really necessary but quite impressive. The manager was a friendly Italian gent. In the book for guests to write things, a couple said they had spent their honeymoon at Playa del Karma. That kind of floored me, because this hotel is more for a few nights to see the town and do some shopping and dinner. It's not a honeymoon type place at all. It was very good value for about $100 per night in the high season, but you might not feel it's worth much more. We did not go for their breakfast because it was extra. The sister hotel where they served the breakfast was really run of the mill. Easy street parking all around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people and hotel but poor location”
Reviews.Author: BigSkyTripper
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms clean but small... bed was really uncomfortable as were the pillows. Nice breakfast at sister hotel. Located on a very busy street and was surprisingly quiet. Kind of a funky little place with lots of character but slightly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great pet friendly hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: jdfnyc
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a small dog and Hotel Playa del Karma was a great choice. The hotel is cozy, comfortable, basic and affordable. The staff was very nice and always helpful. I would recommend for sure for anyone looking for a great value and a convenient location in playa.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay -- a real charmer!”
Reviews.Author: dougie-w
Reviews.Content: My partner and I typically use Priceline to book hotels and have gotten spoiled staying at so many 4-star properties. But we're glad we weren't snobbish about staying at the Playa del Karma, because it had so much going for it, even though it was a lesser hotel. We loved the charm of the place, the hammocks supplied with each room, the modest-yet-stylish bathrooms, the thatched roof, free bottled water, convenient location close to the beach and shops, free wi-fi, and especially the complimentary breakfast at the sister hotel a few blocks away. The food was fantastic!! We weren't too bothered by the Playa del Karma's drawbacks: the lack of a TV in our room; the old and worn bedspread; and the small, unheated pool. Brrrrrr!! We also noticed that the pool's filtration system wasn't being used when we took a dip. The hotel helped us book a half-day trip down to see the ruins at Tulum, and we were very pleased with the service. Including taxes, we paid just $94 per night through Booking.com for a room with a king bed, and we really got our money's worth. If we ever go back to Playa del Carmen, I have no doubt we'll return to this hotel. It was a very pleasant and memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: OK_for_nowGa
Reviews.Content: Small but very comfortable rooms. Extremely helpfull staff. No private parking. Near all of 5th Ave fun.

Reviews.Title: “Sukha spa services Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: trcynr
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had occasion to visit the spa services and yoga classes while visiting Playa Del Carmen. The staff was knowledgable and were able to provide relaxing and therapuetic massage therapy. Oscar and Teresa were fabulous. For just a few dollars more than the cheap quickie like massages on 5th ave, they create a total healing experience, including lighting & music, aroma therapy and a closing cup of tea. They often check in to see if pressure is acceptable and are able to not break the flow. Yoga with Marta was also great. I practice Yoga for about 1 hour daily and she was able to just tweak my postures and help me to feel release where I didn't even know I was holding. My husband went for the first time and as a very stiff, not so flexible over 30 man, he was a good sport but Marta was able to guide us both and tailor the class to meet our needs and knowledge. (And my husband said it wasn't so bad, but it was a little harder work than he thought.) My husband & I have had opportunity to indulge in massages from several different areas of the world, and it was so wonderful to find this spa that really focuses the therapy to heal the body, soul, mind, and spirit....and for all the rest who don't subscribe to the holistic therapy... they do fine job and they will get you feeling Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel with great staffs”
Reviews.Author: sip308
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights in early January when the weather was mostly in 60's. I booked this hotel based on many positive reviews here. I did not have high expectation of the hotel so I can't say I was really disapponted but I was very pleased with all the staffs here. They try hard to make better stay for the customers. I agree with many points of Vermontman. But I knew that it wasn't going to be a highend hotel. This was within my budget. My main problem was the room that I stayed did not have adequate lighting. It was hard to read the book at night. Also I had hot water issue as well. I had to take shower within 3-4 minutes before hot water turns to cold and on my last night I did not have hot water at all to take shower. But the staffs tried all the effort to fix it immediately and apologized. That count a lot. I am glad that I stayed in small hotel in PDC not all inclusive. We get to try many different places to eat and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel,great staff”
Reviews.Author: justjerry
Reviews.Content: Very good 3 star hotel a few blocks from beach.Everyone very helpful.Rooms large with patios and hammocks,nice little courtyard with small pool.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Vermontman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Playa de Karma for four nights with fourteen year old daughter. Been to Playa many times and almost always stay in small hotels like Playa de Karma. I found it to be adequate, as most are, but nothing special. Sister hotel, Hotel Aqualuna, is about the same level but cheaper and has better beds. I don't mean to be negative, but I am amazed that some folks gave this a 5 when it is just ordinary. Perfectly adequate rates a 3 from me. The website makes out that this is a yoga/ holistic type place which, frankly, does not mean much to me, but to those who care, it is really not accurate. There was a yoga teacher one day we were there (I don't do yoga) and massages can be arranged as it true everywhere in Playa, a town not lacking in massage places. Rooms were cute and very clean, but the beds were terrible and sheets were coarse. I know Mexican beds, having spent a great deal of time throughout Mexico. These weren't the hard beds found in Mexican hotels of all categories. These were cheap, springy beds with Walmart sheets. Maybe 150 count. The beds affected my sleep, which is rare as I have slept in $5.00 hotels, in hammocks, on the ground and on roofs, and in Four Seasons. Staff is very nice, rooms are clean, location fine. Shower leaked. I would stay again, but it is just okay. Management could elevate the hotel just by getting better beds and sheets, and not having instant coffee with Coffeemate. Those things don't wreck an experience, but this is a cute hotel with good staff that just misses the mark by a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, very special rooms, very friendly staff and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathanhum
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience at this boutique hotel for a break over Christmas 2009. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room is very tipical and you have to know that you’re not going into a classic hotel room!!! Yes, the rooms have got a Palapa roof and it gave us a very nice feeling. I am a frequent business traveller and have to say the service and friendliness of the staff are equal to most other boutique several stars I have stayed at and certainly exceed any other boutique property I have already visited in the area. This is a small property, not a 1000 room resort. You have to be realistic with your expectations. Quirks and individuality, like all of Playa del Carmen are part of the charm. One of the aspects we enjoyed the most was the privacy. We were left alone to do all we wanted which is exactly what we were looking for. To be frank, the last thing I want to do on vacation is feel obliged to make talks with other guests. Here it was just the right balance. People were friendly but not in your face. We had the Nativo however the room was immaculate, beautifully decorated with Caribbean colors. Breakfast was excellent, I really don’t understand others saying that the quality was not up to their expectations! The variety is there and once again you’re treated like a king. Overall, excellent value for money and we'll certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, ok facilitys, a little pricy”
Reviews.Author: liljacket
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Playa del Karma was highlighted by a very nice staff and a clean but small room. It was a priced a bit higher ($114 USD) then other hotels that were newer as we were asked to look at a hotel that some friends are staying at in Feb. It was much nicer and cost $94 usd. Our roof had a leak the first night but staff fixed it the next day.. It was cold (yes cold in Playa!) and we asked for a blanket at the front desk and we never received one....not sure if staff had any. Also a breakfast is included in the price(so did the other hotel) but was actually at a sister hotel about 3 blocks away. We only went once as the buffet was not very good at all. There is no restaurant or bar at this hotel. They glued down these wooden shampoo holders on the bathroom sink counter which took up all the availble space on the counter...seemed odd to us. We read in TA that guests can hear certain "noises" (aahumm??!!) from other rooms and that was defiantly the case....most of our "windows" were just screens with slats, even in the bathroom!! The last day was not on our reservation confirmation but the staff had confirmed the dates in an unrelated email. I should have caught it when I received it originally but still a mistake they made. The staff did keep us in our original room for the entire stay though. Again a very nice staff but a bit too funky for the price.. Seems this might be popular with younger Euro's backpacking...There are better places for us personally.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I could have asked for”
Reviews.Author: blondemuchacha1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely wonderful. The courtyard in the center of the hotel was great to lay out in the chairs and read. The rooms were cute and so clean. The hotel really gives you the feeling of vacation in every sense of the word. The hotel is only two blocks away from the main drag, with tons of restaurants, bars, shops etc. It's also only a couple of blocks from the beach. Also, they have a meditation/massage/relaxation place on site. After a day of snorkeling, we came back and got a couple's massage five feet away from our hotel room! Everything is walking distance and the staff does everything to try to make your stay easier. They have vouchers so you can get chairs and umbrellas at the beach club too. This hotel is the best bang for your buck, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful retreat in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: DSRarr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between January 2nd and 9th after a two week road trip around California. We'd stayed in well equipped and luxurious hotels and were suprised when we arrived at Hotel Playa Del Karma. As you step off the busy road outside and into the lobby you know this is the perfect place to relax and unwind. The lobby is quite small but quirky and very welcoming, we had a friendly greeting from a member of staff, were checked in and shown to our room really quickly. The room was the suprise to the hotel in that it was very basic, with no TV, no radio and no iron etc. DON'T be put off though, as it turns out it was lovely to kick back in the hammock out front and chill out with the sound of the water feature pouring into the pool while reading, chatting and enjoying a rum or two... There is a pool at the hotel however we didn't use it as we headed off to the beach every day. The pool is small anyway but this is fine as the beach is so beautiful! The hotel supplies vouchers to use at the Marmitas beach club for free sun loungers and umbrella if needed. They also supply towels. The beach is about a ten minute walk away. We had breakfast supplied by the hotel however it is served at it's sister hotel, the Hacienda Paradise. This is a five minute walk and is on the way to the beach. Breakfast was made up of both hot and cold selections which varied each day and was very nice. The hotel is a two minute walk away from all of the shops, bars and restaurants in the busy 5th Avenue area. We didn't hear anything from the bars once we'd had enough and gone to bed however there is a church nearby which has rather loud bells! Not too much of a problem though. The staff were great and they supply a computer in the lobby with free internet access. There is a travel agent attached to the hotel which were great too. Overall we would recommend this hotel to all of our family and friends and we know they would come back as relaxed and refreshed as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, charming and SUPER friendly!”
Reviews.Author: stevio99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days at Christmas 2009. The bells and music of the church across the street were especially atmospheric. The hotel has distinctive style, and the staff (especially Antonello) are as accommodating as those at any luxury hotel in London, Paris or New York. And the location is wonderful, within walking distance of virtually all places to eat, drink, splash and shop! One slight complaint: even though it's the tropics, things can be done to eliminate the slightly musty smell of the room we stayed in (#12). I have allergies, so I was a bit concerned. Great refrigerator in the room, however! Would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a quiet spot for the right price”
Reviews.Author: jsacks132
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is lovely with nice rooms with a lot of character. Staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. Free breakfast at their sister hotel about a five minute away is nothing special but very good. Only problem was that the hot water didn't last very long, but everything else was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: choppillo
Reviews.Content: We began our honeymoon at Playa by staying at Playa del Karma. The rooms are clean and cozy - the hotel atmosphere is very nice, charming, and relaxing, we were glad to experience a different kind of hotel, not the type of stuff you see in bigger chains and "all inclusive" resorts elsewhere. One small annoyance were the mosquito bites (just me, my wife was intact), but it was just one night - the staff sprayed the court the next day. The staff is very helpful. We'd stay there for sure on our next visit. Oh by the way, the location is excellent too, just a few steps from La Quinta Avenida. This place is excellent if you plan to visit Xel Ha, Chichen Itza, Tulum and the like - don't spend big bucks on 5-star hotels if you won't be there during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel that accepts pets”
Reviews.Author: beachlover000
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpful and very committed to providing everything they can to make your stay as comfortable as possible. We go there every time we're in Playa mainly because we travel with a small dog. But even if that wasn't our primary reason for choosing Playa del Karma, we would positively consider the hotel. And those of you who do not travel with pets, don't worry. Not once during any of our stays have we been bothered by the presence of any animal or even known they might be there. No barking or messes anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay close in, with amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: jontraveler17
Reviews.Content: We just spent several days here, and we really enjoyed the experience. We have been going to Playa del Carmen for 25 years, and this was one of the most together hotel experiences we have had there. In fact, as someone who travels for a living, the service here was equal to anything I have encountered world-wide. We usually stay beachside, but for a change decided to try something "inland" in hopes of avoiding the noise & craziness of 5th Ave. and the nighttime beach party scene. Playa del Karma is just a short walk away from the action, but it was quiet and extremely convenient. Our ground floor room was simple, and had a palapa roof [we wanted to be reminded of the old Mexico]. Not fancy. but comfortable. Very comfortable bed, lots of towels, constant hot water, small outside patio with chairs and hammock. What really strikes me about the place is how thoughtfully run it is - not just traveler friendly, but traveler SUPPORTIVE. All the little details: better quality soap and shampoo, thick towels, the free breakfast buffet, the free beach club use, the free fluffy beach towels, the public computer in the lobby, the refrigerator in the room, the access to trips, etc. And the staff was completely amazing - every need & question met with a smile and efficient handling. Cynthia and Oscar at the front desk were especially wonderful, and Beppe at the breakfast bar was charming & helpful. We had a slight billing confusion when we were leaving, and this was immediately and graciously handled. All in all, extremely impressive - an enormously well run Hotel. On the down side, and they are minor issues: lovely jungle-like central courtyard blocked the sun, so patio was darkish; I prefer an outside view balcony - tho i suppose this is typical for a non-beach room. And our neighbors stayed up late talking and smoking out on their patio, and this disturbed us a bit. Overall, we highly recommend Playa Del Karma - it is just so well conceived & managed! Thanks to everyone for making us feel so welcome and cared for...

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel, great staff and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: elifish
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. They have a tour/travel center on site, fresh breakfast included (a brief 10 minute walk away). The staff will provide huge, clean beach towels to you whenever needed, laundry service is available, hammock provided on your porch, and there is a small pool (although it was too cool for us due to shading form the abundant and beautiful garden vegetation). Yoga, Pilates and Massage are available on site. One internet computer was provided in the lobby. Shower pressure left something to be desired, but water was always hot. Room was always kept very clean and they made cute towel animals for you each day. Staff is amazing, friendly, helpful, and pleasant. Easy walk to dive shops, beach, clubs and restaurants. One thing to note: rooms are nonsmoking, but smoking is allowed on the porches and smoke can drift into neighboring rooms through the palapa roof or open windows.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected but...”
Reviews.Author: Castafiore002
Reviews.Content: the staff was amazing. The moment that I stepped into Playa Del Karma, I've received the utmost outstanding customer service. Aldo and Cynthia were really wonderful. The hotel is very cute, very charming, well located (away from the main street). I love how the rooms are presented when you check in; rose petals on the bed, towels shaped into swans, very welcoming. But because the roof is made of palapa, don't expect too much privacy, you can hear your neighbors and that put me off a bit. Also, Orbitz advertised this place as an adult only hotel; let's just say that I was awaken by a playing child one morning and couple with child checked in at the same as me. Breakfast is served in a sister property (not too far and closer to the beach), breakfast is fine. When I got to the sister property, I wished that I had stayed there instead, but nonetheless Playa Del Karma makes for a great stay for a peaceful getaway. Both hotel share the same staff, you get the same outstanding service in either hotel. Aldo, Cynthia, Christian, Leon and Beppe were really great to interact with. Aldo, truely was wonderful and helped with my tour booking problems and airport transportation problems. If you need to book any tours, just use their services (Karma trails), I've got burned booking a tour with a company that was unreliable and Aldo and Christian stepped in and booked my tour and I was rather please.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor was right!”
Reviews.Author: nickkensington
Reviews.Content: Hotel Playa Del Karma is exactly how the website tells you. Charming staff, clean and comfortable and just the place to spend your time whilst in Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and nice relaxation after long trip around Yukatan.”
Reviews.Author: kaprys
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, close to city center, but quiet. Breakfasts are served in another hotel, it takes max 10 minutes to get there. The food is quite ok. Really friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are clean, really cute, especially that they have palapa roofs :-) And this hammock on the porch... Really loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Low key and perfect”
Reviews.Author: WhereToNext212
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here on a recent trip to Playa del Carmen. Aldo and the rest of the staff were incredibly helpful and kind. The ambiance of the hotel was like a small private resort. The palm roofs were probably my favorite touch and did an excellent job weathering the hurricane we encountered! I'd recommend this place to any travelers looking for a great value. Ohh and the complimentary breakfast at the sister hotel was probably my favorite meal during the vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - A must hotel in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: RomanCrusoe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Playa del Karma last October. It made my first trip to Mexico a very pleasant one. The rooms, courtyard and pool were very clean and well maintained. The hotel is conveniently located near the beach and the main pedestrian shopping strip in Playa del Carmen, just a short walk from all main destinations. The restaurant is located at their partner hotel, and serves an excellent complete buffet breakfast, unlike most of the hotels in this area that only serve a limited continental breakfast. For the sake of comparison, one morning we decided to try breakfast in a nearby hotel, and it was an experience not to be repeated. The hotel's guests were mainly adults from the US, Canada and Europe. It is an adult only and gay friendly hotel. The front desk staff was friendly and extremely helpful in all occasions. I would recommend this hotel to couples and singles who desire a quiet and relaxing vacation without the formality of the large resorts.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LITTLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Hastonian
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 10 days at the Playa del Karma.The hotel was in an excellent location -very close to the restaurants/bars but away from the noise.The beach was a little further,but a pleasant stroll with discounts at Mamitas.Everything was well maintained and the facilites of the sister hotel were also available.It was the excellent service and welcoming staff however that was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum080
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Nov 4 - 11 and experienced a warm and welcoming stay at this hotel. The staff are so very considerate and kind - you feel that kind of warmth, like they are welcoming you into their own home. The accommodation is good value and quaint, with a very authentic and tropical feel. The breakfast is a few blocks away - we enjoyed the walk over every morning - and is a good breakfast, with warm foods and also fruit. You can then meander over to the beach club which offers excellent deals for hotel guests for beach chairs and umbrellas and is located on a very nice stretch of beach. Have a lovely stay at the Hotel Playa Del Karma!

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: TheBoySam
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel, I think it only has about 6 rooms, from the outside it doesnt look much but opens up onto a nice quiet courtyard with a small pool. The rooms are a decent size and well presented and the staff are very polite and helpful

Reviews.Title: “amaizing service, friendly and kind!!!”
Reviews.Author: mei-tal13
Reviews.Content: we stayed in playa for 3 days in this hotel and we really loved it, the most friendly and helpfull staff we found in Mexico. the location isnt on the beach but very close to it and to the center. Recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect retreat. A pleasure for the senses”
Reviews.Author: markmach2
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Playa del carmen for the "party time" spring break experience, this is NOT the hotel for you. But if you choose to stay in Playa del Carmen in a hotel just to relax, forget about the stresses of home and everything in general, you will definitely find your space here. My husband and I went to Playa for a short week end getaway to celebrate our wedding anniversary. As soon as we walked in to the hotel reception we knew we would have the weekend we imagined and staff was extremely welcoming and accommodating. We immediately slowed our stepped, took our time, and forgot the stresses of the outside world. We went to Mamitas Beach but in a way we were wishing we had just stayed at the hotel that, even if small, has its own charme and karma . The hotel has next to the fewest number of rooms in the center of Playa del Carmen and thereby it is not crowded. It is naturally quite in the garden and birds are surrounding you. Amazing if you think you're right in the middle of Playa. What would I have changed? Not much I would say. The restaurant is not available on site but it is such a short pleasant walk that it did not really bother us, especially when we saw the choice they gave us and the setting of the Hacienda paradise....a very nice one. If you want to relax, not think, and have someone else taking care of your stay, Playa del Karma should be should be a contender in your decision process. I would highly recommend it. Mark & Lisa

Reviews.Title: “simply the best Hotel service in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: mia46
Reviews.Content: Who said you have to visit 5 stars places to find the best of the best? I had this unique opportunity of trying this small hotel while walking along the 15th Avenue and was immediately caught by the beauty of the small pool and garden. Rooms are stilish and though simple they express the true essence of a rural Mexican house with all comforts needed. I truly had a good time and staff made a difference when daily they were suggesting me the do`s and dont`s of the destination. I only got very useful tips and can't thank them enough for what they offered me. By the way, the hotel is only 2 minutes walk fronm the busy Fifth Avenue but enjoys all the tranquility that their garden can guarantee.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: RedWhiteChicago
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy place but it has really nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for money. Deserve more than what they ask for!”
Reviews.Author: arniepet
Reviews.Content: Second time in Playa in just over 6 months. My wife and I really wanted to go back and decided to try out this wonderful small hotel just off the 5th avenue. It has a magic atmosphere right from the start. Our room was like surrounded by the garden. Simple and detailed at the same time, definitely more than we could imagine. Service is just amazing. The staff goes the extra mile to make you always feel home....always surprising and anticipating us. We have hardly seen hotels with such a level of courtesy. Even in the luxury US major chains we haven`t experienced anything similar. Again, it is not about the facilities of the hotel, it is about the simplicity of the environment and the spontaneous personnel that makes the whole place worth a longer visit . We are still travelling through Yucatan thanks to the concierge suggestions they gave us at the hotel Playa del karma. During their low season one can definitely get the best deals. If you plan to go to the Riviera Maya, do not miss this beautiful hotel in Playa del Carmen. It is just worth more than what they ask for. Peter & Wendy

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming boutique hotel convenient for divers”
Reviews.Author: tnieusma
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I travel, we usually stay at big, impersonal "americancized" timeshares. This time, we wanted something more authentic. The Playa del Karma was so charming and we loved not having a tv or phone - we were able to "unplug" from reality and really enjoy our time together. This place is cute with the palapa roofs and hammocks by each front door. The staff is incredibly helpful and you can tell they have pride in what they do. The location was perfect, just a couple of blocks off the main drag. Close enough to enjoy, but far enough from the nightly noise. There were many dive shops within walking distance and the surrounding restaurants were great. We would definitely pick this place again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff really cares about your comfort and enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: SRtravelnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Playa del Karma for a long weekend with a group of friends. The service was fantastic, even before we got there. Karma Trails, their in-house concierge service made it so easy to make reservations and plan ahead. The rooms were very clean and spacious and the hammocks were amazing. The common amenities (the pool, the outdoor lounge area on the 2nd floor) gave our trip a special homely feel. The time at the hotel was just as enjoyable as our time on the beach and at the cenotes!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonZoe
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Playa del Karma. Both 5th Avenue and the beach are easily within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and economical basestation for exploring the area”
Reviews.Author: pbmax78
Reviews.Content: I agree with a previous review describing this as very basic accomidations, but tasteful and friendly. The front office staff and even the next door tour agency was helpful to advise us for multiple unexpected bumps in the road we met in our travels (none related to the hotel itself). The room was nicely appointed and has a wall-unit airconditioner that worked reasonable well (this is KEY in Playa del Carmen). The water-pressure was at standard municipal pressure: very poor. The "wireless internet" only works in the small front office. There is a computer there which technically is limted use then charged, but--typical of Mexican culture--this is more of a guideline than a rule. Also, the breakfast voucher does NOT mean it is free; we forgot to pay, but they were very kind about clarifying that. In summary, this hotel is ideal for the traveller who wishes comfortable no-frills accomidations (with some addtional charm) and wants to spend most of their time exploring and travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: bagdadjeff
Reviews.Content: Hotel Playa del Karma is a cozy little hotel two blocks from the 5th Avenue. While not directly at the beach, the hotel is an oasis in this touristy town. Especially the "Native" rooms are great (traditional architecture, nice interior and very comfortable). Breakfast is served in a nearby partner-hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The "Karma" is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Rustic, Friendly, Quiet, and Delicious Breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: DickLane
Reviews.Content: Rustic, tropical decor. Friendly, efficient service. Quiet, yet close to action. Delicious complementary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in a charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SonjaWien
Reviews.Content: I was there for 3 weeks and I felt really comfortable! The whole stuff is kind, friendly and always helpful. The beach is 3 blocks and the Avenida Quinta 2 blocks away. The room is not to big, but it has everything you need - kingsize-bed, fridge, a charming bathroom, A/C and a patio with hammock in the beautiful garden with a small pool. Free internet is in place at the rezeption. And the most important thing for me - it was all very clean!! For breakfast you have to go to the sister-hotel Hacienda Paradise, which isn´t a problem at all! The stuff there was just as friendly and helpful as in Karma - all together are actually a big family and I felt very rescued. I will definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “a truly mexican vacation experience made special by truly nice people”
Reviews.Author: sweetlife31
Reviews.Content: The endless positive reviews already speak a lot about this place. When we first embarked on this holiday we were hesitating, as my wife, and I have normally stay 4* without exception on all of our family holidays. It was only when struggling to decide on our hotel in Playa del Carmen that we stumbled upon Hotel Playa del Karma, and began reading the reviews. I searched over and over for the bad review and I found very, very few, all diligently answered by the manager who seems very much on top of things. I somehow knew that all these people leaving positive reviews couldn't be wrong so we decided to go for it and give it a try. Our first experience of “Leon” shear profesionalism and dedication to his guests came when we entered the property and were warmly welcomed by him. When you arrive at Playa del Karma, the very first thing you notice is the greenery of the beautiful tropical garden and the scenic pool (small one) that is ideal to refresh. The hotel itself is more like a ethnic boutique hotel (as they call it) than anything else, rustic and peculiar at the same time. Breakfast is served in their twin hotel Hacienda Paradise, very close and very charming too. We could even use their pool service if we wanted to and were treated as if we were guests of that hotel. After all they belong to the same company. There is no better way than a colorful buffet that included the unexpected to start our day full of activities. Cristian and Aurea at Karmatrails, the concierge service, are simply one of the kindest, warmest and most helpful people we have ever had the pleasure of meeting and they made our stay even recommending beautiful places and excursions . Thanks also go to Bepe who prepared beautiful cappuccinos and expreso just the way only Italians can do. Rooms are nice and colorful, maybe just a little dark but fully surrounded by this vegetation and curios birds singing in the morning. A real bravo to all of them. They know how to treat their guests and they’ll go the extra mile to make you come back. We already promised them…and WE'LL BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely traditional boutique budget hotel in Carmen”
Reviews.Author: MarieclareLondon
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay on our arrival into Cancun (1 hour on the bus from the airport) for one night before travelling another hour the following day on to Tulum and this place seemed like the place to unwind and experience a bit more of an authentic Mexican stay (generic resort types aren't my thing). The hotel was just as nice as I'd imagined and each room looked like it was individually done. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, even though my Spanish was very minimal! We liked it so much, we booked to stay there on our last night on our way back from Tulum and towards Cancun Airport. I would definitely recommend for those looking for traditional, small and not a very big budget. Our room was about $70 plus taxes and well worth it. It was pretty quiet (cos of the swine flu and recession perhaps, as all of that part of Mexico was quiet) and the restaurant for breakfast (included in the room price) was closed but they had a sister hotel that we could have our breakfast at around 4 blocks away. The beach was around a 7-10 min walk away too. So well located for shops, bars and beach.

Reviews.Title: “A charming oasis at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Cocoricot
Reviews.Content: Playa del Karma was so charming. Our room was simple, comfortable and clean. It had a vaulted palapa roof which made the space feel very roomy. The staff were very friendly and the gardens and pool were magical. If you have the opportunity , take advantage of the sweat lodge they have nestled among the greenery of the garden. I traveled with my 13 yr old son. We both loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great small budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neighbor_Dave
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel two days before and two days after a week in Akumal.
