The hotel is very cute with very beautiful gardens in the central area and a small pool that is suitable for cooling off after a steamy day at the beach if not large enough for a full swim. The people were very friendly and helpful. The room was a nativo quadruple which while somewhat small, had a king size bed downstairs and a loft with a palapa roof which contained two single beds. The air conditioning worked great, although it was a little warmer up in the loft which has an open window with screen that competes with the AC. A few minor problems we encountered were figuring out three days before our trip that they are trying to cater to adults and not families. This is not stated on their website as far as I can tell, and they even had a location for number of children on the reservation form I filled out, but I later found another site that noted they were a gay friendly and adult couples hotel. So, after a last minute panic, they were nice enough to let us stay there with our children anyway. The room was pretty clean, but when I tried to put some of my sons stuff in a night stand drawer, there was a little bit of garbage including a condom wrapper. Could have done without that, but I guess that could happen at any hotel, just missed by the maid. Upon our return in the same room, it was gone. Also, there is a sewer gas problem. They have a cover in the shower drain that you need to keep in place. It was not there on our first arrival, so I'm guessing it is a rainy season thing, that happened in the intervening week. Probably a city wide problem this time of year would be my guess, and really was not a big issue, but I would have liked to have been told about it when we checked in. I consider the complaints to be generally minor, and would stay here again for the price, it was over all a good experience, and I would recommend it to someone looking for a nice budget motel. It is not far to the beach or Avenida Quinta, but far enough away to be fairly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly athmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Miltsi
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with very good price vs. quality. We spent there four nights altogether and everything went very well. Location is good near the 5th avenue and very nice especially for those that want to be close to the 5th avenue but want to avoid the loud noise coming from the party area. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Would definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “It is a very special hotel”
Reviews.Author: CK1_Frankfurt
Reviews.Content: staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and very cozy, if we are next time in playa del carmen we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: gymdive22
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something that was affordable and had rustic charm, yet still had the amenities that we're used to. Hotel Playa del Karma fit the bill perfectly. The location is great--within walking distance of everything, but slightly off the main drag, so it's nice and quiet at night. We had a second-floor room with a cute porch and hammock. The room was well-sized, with a shower big enough for two (and great water pressure). The room had air conditioning, which was a welcome relief after hot days on the beach. It was also very clean and we didn't see any bugs. The one downside was the padding in the mattress--or lack thereof. It felt like sleeping on two bare box springs. I also wished there had been an actual closet instead of just a nook with room for a few hangers, but it wasn't a huge problem. Our room came stocked with a great selection of local fresh fruit (for free!). The hotel serves a basic complimentary breakfast (additional items are available for a fee). As for the service--it was excellent! Everyone on staff was extremely friendly and willing to help at any moment. The hotel arranged for our transfer to and from the airport, and had good suggestions on places to eat in the area. They also offer excursion packages to Mayan ruins and other attractions, but we were able to find somewhat cheaper deals through other companies. Our room came with complimentary passes to the Mamitas Beach Club, which I would definitely recommend. The club is a good walk from the hotel but it's worth the hike, because it sits on arguably the best strip of beach in Playa. The hotel also provided us with towels. Overall I would recommend Hotel Playa del Karma--the hotel was very fairly priced, had a great atmosphere, excellent location, and was a relaxing place to come back to after a day in Playa. We'd most likely stay here again (especially if they add some padding to the mattresses!)

Reviews.Title: “Playa Del Karma - Peaceful Tropical Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: heart_trips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa del Karma for 7 nights and absolutely loved it! The location of the hotel is perfect, within a short walk to the beach and all the shops & bars on 5th avenue, but remote enough to be quiet and still in a very safe neighborhood. The bed in our room was super-huge, the A/C cooled down the room instantly and it was always really quiet there, so it's a perfect place to go back and relax at the end of the day. The rooms themselves are very simple but are always clean and have all the basic stuff that you need. The coolest part we thought were the thatched roofs and the amazingly beautiful luscious tropical landscaping. The rooms are very private, they all look out into the courtyard with the palm trees, all kinds of colorful flowers and a small sparkling pool with a waterfall. Every room also has a patio, which is enclosed on the sides, with a couple chairs and a hammock. The hotel office also has a computer with free internet and a small library. Our free breakfast was served at their sister hotel Hacienda Paradise, which is a few blocks away and we also got discounted passes to the Mamita's Beach Club with loungers and palapas. The staff at Playa Del Karma is extremely accommodating. We happened to get a day with no activities planned and they were able to make arrangements for a great tour for us that very morning on a moment's notice, had us picked up and driven to the group that was already on their way. Overall, we had great experience and this hotel was a big part of our unforgettable vacation memories.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, relaxing, friendly little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traveljones25
Reviews.Content: My friend and I found Hotel Playa del Karma through Expedia and got an amazing deal on our trip. The hotel is small, located just a couple blocks from Calle 5 and near enough to everything to walk and get to see all the parts of town. There is no phone, tv, or radio in the room but there is an air conditioner that is essential in summertime! The service there was fabulous, the staff was very friendly and helpful and gave us honest and great recommendations for restaurants. We walked to Calle 30 the last night and ate a tiny local restaurant called Los Amigos- best guac in town! The hotel is also one block from Coco Bongo which is a very popular club in the area (though we didn't go!) The hotel offers spa services in a "healing hut" which we didn't utilize- we did, however, get massages on Calle 5 for only $25.00 a person for one hour and it was fabulous. Also, if you like smoothies and healthy food, hit up 100% natural- it's one of my favorite restaurants in town. Karma also has a connection with Mamitas club on the ocean so you can rent chairs and umbrellas for very cheap! I highly recommend this place if you aren't looking for anything fancy and like to be a little off the beaten path!

Reviews.Title: “dont hesitate to stay @karma”
Reviews.Author: lililuv
Reviews.Content: very good in everyway! stayed at 4 places in mexico & this is the fav by far no complaints-our room is the green one pictured.absolutely perfect. only dislike is/was the breakfast.after the first time we didnt bother but everything else made up for it. location! staff! travel agent! pool! rooms! cleanliness! todo esta muy bien!!!! go for it! this is the one in playa del carmen :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Value, Best Service”
Reviews.Author: susanmet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Playa del Karma on a recommendation from a friend. We were extremely satisfied with the accomadations and the staff. This hotel was the best hotel I've ever stayed at in terms of value for what you receive. The rooms are cute (a little rustic but clean and comfortable), the courtyard is beautiful and the staff went above and beyond to serve us or answer questions. The location is great, just three blocks from the beach. We would definitely come back...

Reviews.Title: “Playa's hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: niklectric
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Playa del Karma for 5 nights and found it very pleasant, clean and affordable. It is a few blocks away from Avenida 5 (the main drag with shops, restaurants and bars), so at first I was worried about being too far from the action. My worries were quelled, however, when after a loud night out on the town, we were able to retire quietly to Hotel Playa del Karma and relax peacefully. We booked a Karma room (#21) which features include a secure safe, coffee maker, a complimentary fruit bowl, the requisite mini-bar, AC and TV. The rooms look a tad bigger on the website, so we were glad to make good use of the huge porch in front of our room, which was furnished with a hammock, two chairs and a table as well as an adequate light for reading. The concierge was really helpful when it came to giving advice on what to do, what to see and transportation information. There was a modest continental breakfast each morning in the hotel's upstairs restaurant, where there was coffee (mexican and regular), hot water for tea, bread for toast, an assortment of cereals, sweet breads (like pound cake and a chocolately thing), butter, jam and juice. There also appeared to be a number of liquados, fresh juices and smoothies available for a cost. The hotel also features a leafy, lush courtyard with a small pool. The pool was big enough for a soak and a chat with friends, but is nothing you'd swim laps in. There was also a waterfall in the pool that ran occasionally. The sauna on the side of the pool looked interesting, but once we learned that it was actually a spa service and cost $75 usd to book it, it didn't seem quite so appealing. When we made our reservation for the Karma room, the hotel included free wi-fi and free passes for Mamita's beach club, both of which we found to be great perks. The hotel is a good jumping off point to several destinations. It is close to an ADO bus station and just a few minutes walk to the collectivos vans on Avenida 2 as well as the ferry station where you can catch the boat to Cozumel. Overall, this hotel was great for the price. There are a lot of places to stay in Playa, but be sure to consider this hidden treasure if you're after a more peaceful, affordable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTraveler99
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for 5 nights for around $80 per night. At that rate, you really can't beat it. It was good to be able to spend time on busy 5th Avenue with all the shops and nightlife but to be able to come back into this little oasis as soon as you step through the front door and into the courtyard with the pool and plants and trees. It really felt like stepping into another world. I was concerned about the palapa roof, but I really grew to enjoy it. It gave the room a more authentic Mexican vibe. There was no tv in the room but I noticed that I did not need it. If you are the type of person who likes to be in your room a lot during vacation, then this may not be the place for you. As for me, I spent all of my time on the beach or out enjoying the city, so I spent a limited amount of time in my room. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, reasonably located, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cchitchix
Reviews.Content: Hotel is small and very nice, lots of ambience. On a street with a lot of traffic but surprisingly quiet. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “fascinated with the tranquility”
Reviews.Author: alwayscool
Reviews.Content: we stayed 6 days in this lovely hotel, where instead of a normal garden they had a kind of small jungle, very nice, with a relaxing swimming pool. The staff always solved our problems and where there for everything we need. Rooms like cabins, palm roof and equpment with almost everything, except for a t.v. but we really didnt need it. We are very grateful and we hope to come back next year. Thanks a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Metztlillena
Reviews.Content: We spent 20 days at this hotel and our stay was really unforgettable. It was our little oasis in the middle of busy Playa del Carmen. The service is excellent. Friday dinners are great. The fact that every day you come back to your room you find not only spotless cleanliness but also really cute "towel sculptures" reveals with how much care they treat every guest. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time at Playa del Karam.”
Reviews.Author: FDeCastro
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 weeks at Playa Del karma. We stayed in a palapa room with a high ceiling thatched roof. While the room was air conditioned, we never turned it on as the fan over our bed provided enough cooling. Our room did not have a TV or phone but it did not bother us as we spent all our evenings outside. The hotel offers Spa services as well as yoga classes. I did not try the massages at the hotel but had a massage at Mamitas beach club (much cheaper). The whole surrounding is very charming with a small swimming pool, flowers and palm trees. The ambience is very quiet and relaxing even though your are only 5-10 minutes from 5th Avenue the busiest street in Playa. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We went on 2 trips organized by the hotel travel agency (Tulum-Coba and Chichen Itza) which is highly recommended. If you have a chance go to Playa Paraiso, the most beautiful beach close to Playa Del Carmen. Just take the Colletivo Bus to Tulum ruins and it is 20min walk to the beach. The hotel has a special deal with Mamitas Beach Club which is the best place in Playa to enjoy the beach. Overall we had a great stay at this hotel and we would certainly return. If there is one negative point I would say their continental breakfast is a bit poor and it would be nice to have more local pastries or choice of fruits. They do have a menu of omelets, pancakes etc (but it is not free).

Reviews.Title: “Imaginative decor and friendly non-intrusive staff”
Reviews.Author: Pantyllin
Reviews.Content: Short walk to 5th Avenue but far enough away to be tranqill. Lovely court yard garden. Very interesting rooms. excellent fans and aircon

Reviews.Title: “Excellent interior and atmosphere, very kind and helpful employees; very clean!”
Reviews.Author: KingofFrogs
Reviews.Content: Very good quality/price ratio - everything very good; maybe liitle more variety in the continental brakfast desirable.

Reviews.Title: “Great oasis in the middle of town.”
Reviews.Author: BobBellingham
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed the last two nights of our vacation in Playa del Carmen and we were looking for a quiet place not right on 5th ave. We found the perfect place in Playa del Karma. It is a charming little hotel just a couple blocks from 5th ave. and the beaches. There is a beautiful garden in the courtyard with a small pool that is great for cooling off after a day of shopping or at the beaches. Our room was small, but adequate and very charming and romantic with the plapa roof and fan. The staff were very friendly and helpful and gave us great information about where to eat and things to do and see in Playa del Carmen. We would definately stay there again when in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience to complete the perfect get-away vacation”
Reviews.Author: ready2travel1026
Reviews.Content: We went to Playa del Carmen during Spring Break season so the city was packed, however Hotel Playa del Karma was a perfect only two block distance away from Quinta Avenida that kept the noise away while resting, but quick walking distance when heading out to the beach and nightlife. Being between 12th and 14th, you can walk either way down Quinta Avenida to reach the ferries that take you to Cozumel or the other way that reaches the really nice beaches of the city. The service is amazing, it's like staying at a friend's house because it's so warming, small and the people are willing to help you in any way. We were preparing a couple snacks for the beach and the kitchen gladly lent us a knife. We were laying on our hammocks at night and in a heartbeat the lobby gave us bug spray to keep the mosquitoes away. The rooms are palapas so they are pretty simple, the thing is that you don't spend much of your time in them though. There are no tvs but laying on your hammock enjoying the hotel trees, flowers and tranquility makes you forget about technology. Definitely come here if you want a vacation to rest and enjoy the Mexican culture.

Reviews.Title: “Unique last minute deal in Playa del Karma”
Reviews.Author: jamesbond007Toronto
Reviews.Content: I and my wife were looking for a last minute deal in Playa del Carmen and found Playa del Karma offering this very innovative formula called xperience last minute that I guess would help the management filling their reservation’s gaps. We booked 6 nights stay knowing that we were subject to room change according to the hotel necessity. The Manager explained us that they are willing to offer the room with a considerable discount providing the guest is conscious of possible room change during the stay. In the end we were shifted to another room only once and we did not worry about anything since the staff took care of everything themselves. We were back from the beach and our luggage was already in the other room…obviously we were informed well in advance. A good compromise if you think we saved over 30% on the normal rate they apply. The hotel is beautiful. Cozy and welcoming with a nice garden and pool. We also took advantage of their holistic room where we had a very regenerating therapy for two. Our room was fascinating; a beautiful palm roof and a patio where we spent most of the time reading our books. A real deal we would recommend everyone to take advantage of. Gamil Feb. 2009

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, good wi-fi, plenty of room to dry my Dive Equipment!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cuevo
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Playa Del Carmen and was much happier with Playa Del Karma than I was with the place I stayed previously (casa de gopola). I plan on returning, several times for cave diving and the next time down, I plan to stay with Playa Del Karma. It is a quiet comfortable atmosphere w/ very comfortable beds, good bathrooms, refrigerator, reliable WI-FI, and a coffee pot in the room. I also like the little porch in front of my room, I was able to let my diving equipment dry w/out having to worry about it. There are a few bodegas, a pharmacy, and a convenience store right around the corner, so you can pick up a few things that you might need w/out having to go to 5th ave and pay too much for simple things.

Reviews.Title: “Little oasis in the middle of town, GREAT staff!”
Reviews.Author: Just_Jay82
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently returned from two weeks in the Mayan Riveira, with 6 nights at Hotel Playa del Karma. The staff were excellent-- they were extremely friendly and helpful, non-intrusive, and made us feel very welcome. The rooms felt authentic-- the traditional thatched roofs were very special and the bathrooms were a good size. The proximity to the beach and 5th Avenue was very convenient--everything is very walkable. The wireless was very useful as well! However, there were a couple downsides. The "pool" isn't really functional. It is very small (could be used for a quick cool off, but we didn't see anyone in it) but generally not used. However, being so close to the beach, it didn't matter to us at all-- one wouldn't sun tan at the hotel so the lack of a decent pool didn't matter. Also, the hotel is across the road from the biggest church in Playa, which rings its bells once and a while. It's actually nice sound, but on Sunday, the bells start at 7.30am and continue every 20-30 minutes for most of the day. In spite of this, I would still recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could easily become a wonderful destination”
Reviews.Author: shorevet
Reviews.Content: While the staff at Playa del Karma is truly wonderful some physical restraints and poor management decisions detract from this little hotel. It is an old renovated hostel with few amenities. Reading lights would have made our room less gloomy, however there has been investment in making them comfortable -good beds, ceiling fans, small refrigerator and TV. The free continental breakfast suffers badly. The coffee is weak, the orange juice is watered down orange drink, and inexplicably the only cereals offered are sugary kids offerings! The bread is white bread, no yogurt, no fruit. The $5-6 breakfast that is offered is sub-par complimented with the same poor coffee, orange drink and bread. On most days we ate breakfast around the corner ; it was cheaper and excellent. All this said with the church bells across the street getting us up at 7:45, and some noise the place has charm thanks to the staff. I would hope that management appreciates them and realizes how easily improvements could be made to this little potential gem of a hotel (church bells aside).

Reviews.Title: “It was a bit like camping”
Reviews.Author: SpikeLeeds_
Reviews.Content: We were staying in a luxury hotel in Cancun but for a change of scenery we had arranged to stay at the Playa Del Karma. The hotel was pretty and quaint but lets just say the hotel room was very different to anything I have stayed in before. We did not realise when we booked that the roof was actually a palapa or straw type construction. This meant that we could hear the noise from the nightlife and also the road and passers by. It was also a little windy so the roof rustled and gave the impression of sleeping in a barn!!. It was a bit spooky too. We had a lizard in the room which we could not catch and there was also a number of bugs and mosquitos flying around. I found the experience very different to your normal hotel room and unfortunately did not get a wink of sleep. Maybe it's because I am British and do not stay in this type of hotel room. To be fair we complained about our ordeal and the manager did offer us a room with a fixed roof but to be honest we had had enough so decided to return to our all inclusive luxury in Cancun,

Reviews.Title: “Our Kind of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ricardinho_Brasil
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that this is our kind of hotel: Simple, clean, well located and nice staff . We stayed here for the first 3 nights of our honeymoon, on the way to Cozumel and Cancun. I general we liked the hotel very much. Very well located. The hotel is on 15th, so 2 blocs from 5th street (pedestrian shopping street) and 3 blocks from the beach. our room had a mini fridge, fan, air conditioner but no TV (which was great for us) Depending on the room you are staying you might get a free ticket to mamitas beach club, ours didn't give one for free but the hotel sold tickets for 2 loungers and shade for a better price than at the beach itself. Since we went to mamitas only once (it's worth going) there was no reason to pay more for a room just to get the free tickets. Actually, the entrance to Mamitas is free. What you pay is for the rent of the loungers, beach beds , shades, etc. The room was ground floor and we didn't hear any noise from the street. Bed was nice and it was very easy to sleep after a day touring Tulum and Coba We used the travel agency to book the excursion to the ruins, price was fair and service very nice There was one thing we really didn't like and that's the reason I didn't 5 stars, the breakfast . though it's just a continental breakfast, so you expect something simple, there was actually just toast, cereal, cake and some fruit included. One day my wife had a Banana and also wanted a grapefruit but the employee said the second fruit would cost an extra dollar. Eggs and Omelet ware great but cost an extra US$ 5.00, I guess it should be so hard to add some different types of breads and include some ham, cheese and even eggs as a courtesy

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, closer to nature, less plastic.”
Reviews.Author: RedEdBuffalo
Reviews.Content: For those of us baby boomers who remember being sensitive flower children Hotel Play del Karma really suited us. The mature greenery of the courtyard had the serenity and grace of years of wise existence; of course we could relate! The patter of raindrops on the thatched roof of the room reminded us that we were in a beautiful tropical climate. It was a charming effect that would have been absent had we stayed in a concrete & glass megalith. We thoroughly enjoyed the ambience here. The breakfasts above the garden were special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms are ok, loud at night”
Reviews.Author: emmyonthemove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before we were to fly home out of Cancun because this was one of the few hotels in Playa del Carmen that would accept a single night's stay. The location of this hotel is fantastic - it is a 5 minute walk to 5th street - the major shopping/eating/tourist area. There is no dedicated parking, but we found street parking fairly easily. The hotel is attractive, with a central, beautifully landscaped little courtyard containing an immaculate but tiny little bathing pool and a couple of reading chairs. The staff were great too - very welcoming. Our room, however, was not as nice - it was very small (barely bigger than the king sized bed it contained), dark, and damp - very musty even with the windows open and the fan running. A bigger issue however was the street noise at night - the rooms are thatched roof style and contain a set of open spaces under the rafters for ventilation. These can't be closed and, on a Saturday night, the noise from the traffic, from people heading home after a night out, from a bunch of barking dogs in the alley out back, and from a loud Rave that set up somewhere near the hotel between 2-5am, meant my husband and I were pretty bleary by sun-up. This hotel would be fine if you plan to sleep on the beach during the day, but probably not great if you want a restful respite. We would not stay here again if traveling to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Can't do better than Hotel Playa Del Karma”
Reviews.Author: CarribbeanPiner
Reviews.Content: a hidden treasure nestled in bustling Playa del Carmen is the Hotel Playa Del Karma. The clever tongue-in-cheek name is just where the fun starts. Everything here has been laid out to give their guests the most relaxing and peaceful surroundings along with the convenience of a walk of only a block or two from all the excitement and shopping. A small pool is complemented by a waterfall lulling you into complete relaxation--staying awake is the only challenge you will face! The rooms are immaculately clean with peaked, thatched roofs and the general ambiance of a cabana on the beach. Yet, the amenities are first rate and, unlike many such hotels in the area, the hot water really IS! .But over and above all else is the attentiveness of their staff, particularly Carina who is perhaps the most excellent hotel staff person I have ever seen...constantly making sure each and every guest is happy and well cared for. If you're looking for a comfortable, relaxing, lovely hotel just a stone's throw from the action in Playa del Carmen--this is it. So close, yet so far...once you enter this lovely paradise you cannot believe you are so close to all the bustle because you feel instantly that you're on a secluded beach. An AWESOME place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: angb77
Reviews.Content: Well there are so many reviews and photos on here I don't have a lot else to say, but I just wanted to add my two cents because I enjoyed my stay here so much. This hotel is extremely clean. My husband and I had a king-sized bed and a bungalow that had two levels - the upstairs had an additional two beds! The style here is very unusual and cool. We liked to just hang out by the plunge pool and drink coffee/tea when we were tired of the beach. They also offer free breakfast in the morning and free internet which is nice. This hotel is very centrally located and an easy walk to beach, nightlife, etc. and most of the rooms have outdoor hammocks that you can use (ours did not because we had the larger "house"). The only weird thing I will say is our "house" was directly next to the kitchen and dining area, so in the morning it was basically like we were sleeping IN the kitchen. This wouldn't have been so bad except we chose to sleep with the windows open (all the rooms do have A/C but we didn't use ours) and so the smells/noises of breakfast were quite strong. Again, I don't want to say that the hotel is noisy (it is quite the opposite) but out of all the rooms in the hotel, ours is the only one that would have this problem because of where it was located, and I wouldn't have even noticed if we had been using our A/C. So you may want to request that you not have the room located next to the breakfast dining area/kitchen. It didn't bother me that much, but it was kind of weird. The other thing is, we had a little bit of a hard time finding this hotel (I don't know why, because it is very central as I said) and NONE of the locals had heard of it. Anyone on the street that we asked mistakenly thought we just kept saying "Playa del Carmen" wrong. So that was a bit frustrating. If you are going to be walking here (as we did) from the ferry port, make sure you have a good map or know where you are going because it seems like the locals aren't that familar with the name of this place. It is sort of near Coco Bongo's if that helps at all.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and friendly”
Reviews.Author: constant_traveler87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It's an amazing value and the staff are extremely personable and friendly. We stayed in room 10. Our room was definitely rustic, but large and with much character. The shower got very hot and had good water pressure. The air conditioning kept the room at a nice temperature even with the heat outside. The dipping pool in the courtyard was very refreshing after a hot walk back from 5th avenue. The mattress was very uncomfortable, but the pillows were nice!! Unfortunately for us, we were visiting family at a nearby all-inclusive resort, so we didnt spend much time at Playa, but when we return to Playa del Carmen, this budget hotel will be at the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Back to mayan times...”
Reviews.Author: opedoussaut
Reviews.Content: The intimacy of a private house, the warm welcome of a bed and breakfast, the service of a high end hotel and an unique touch of Mayan spirit... that's how we'll always remember Playa Del Karma. To be fairly honest we have a few complains: Quite pricy in high season... but at the regular rate that's a great deal. I think that for a continental breakfast there's a few things missing: eggs, fresh fruits, bacon, cheese..., available only if you paid extras (around 5$ US/ item). Which doesn't make sense as you can get a whole buffet on 5th avenue for around the same price in a fancy restaurant. But except those small flaws that was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, cosy atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: AAndreea
Reviews.Content: Cosy hotel, in a quiet, sheltered garden. Very good location, central but just off the main, crowded street. Can be a bit loud at night from the neighbouring disco, but apparently every place in Playa has the same problem. Very friendly staff and good service (it's a surprise everyday to see the way the towels are folded).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - great staff”
Reviews.Author: Nyer26
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay at the PdK - the staff was very welcoming and accomodating and the location was great - just off of the nicest part of 5th Ave, but quiet, not in the middle of the action. Access to Mamitas Beach is also a great plus. Can't argue with the price either. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden oasis full of good karma, spa wellness and organic foods”
Reviews.Author: FlorenciaZulberti
Reviews.Content: Few places in Playa del Carmen seem to embrace the concept of “wellness”, “peace” and “tranquility as whole-heartedly as this place and its very friendly staff does. When you walk in the door you leave behind the heat and traffic of downtown Playa del Carmen and enter a siren oasis filled with palm trees and the refreshing sound of a waterfall into a pool. The simple yet spacious and very comfortable rooms circle this inner patio that lights up at night with tiny lights that set the tone for an enchanting evening. Being true to the whole “karma” philosophy, my standard room had no TV but it did have both air-conditioning and a ceiling fan and there is wireless Internet throughout the hotel, including their lovely open-air restaurant area on the 2nd floor balcony where you can enjoy a lovely home-made breakfast every morning with freshly squeezed and/or blended juices like the Mexican green juice (my favorite!). And if eating and sleeping soundly is not enough to cleanse your soul, the hotel also offers a wide variety of massage therapies, including a Craneosacral message (my first!), and the must try “temazcalito” experience, which is the Mexican version of the sauna in its simplest form as it involves lots of chanting and opening of spiritual doors. Definitely it is a place you want to call home for a few days…if not forever!

Reviews.Title: “Almost ok”
Reviews.Author: traveller66-TA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite all right. Place is quite clean and safe. Our room was basic, no chaire, no balcony. They try to sell little bit too hard their tours. Some of staff are ok. What I didnt like was overcharge from creditcard. Even if it was only 15 dollars, but still it is not ok.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay for backpackers in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Ricki19751983
Reviews.Content: Playa Del Karma is the perfect residency to stay when you are in Playa del Carmen, Mexico. The staf is very helpfull and friendly, even the nightwatch who has some difficulty in speaking english will do almost everything to help you out and the prices are most reasonable. In addition to to that the Antonello Pascuzzo, who we believe owns the hotel?, as a small travel agency in the hotel called KARMA trails. He really helped us out in getting around in Yukatan mexico and arranged hotels and trips for us at our request at most reasonable prices. We had a lonely planet with us from Mexico (edition september 2008) but Playa Del Karma is not in there. We stronly believe it should be in the Lonely Planet! In short: The perfect residency for backpackers or travellers in Yukatan Mexico. Once more, Antonello and staf, thank you very much for your help, perfect care during our stay in Playa Del Karma. Greeting, Richard Peeters and Anique Houben. The Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “Karma Chameleon!”
Reviews.Author: dara13
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to my expectations and more! I honestly was at a crossroads on where to stay in Playa del Carmen during the holiday season, as there were so many options, but I had no idea about location and value. I started my search here at trip advisor, and based on the reviews, pictures and price I booked my trip through Expedia, and it couldn't have been easier. From the customer service over the phone to the warm reception I received upon arrival, this hotel made me feel like I was walking into a home.My first experience was with Marlene at reception, and she guided me to a place to eat and explained everything with hospitality and courtesy. My room was adorable, and felt like a comfy little bed and breakfast. I loved coming "home" from yoga and the beach everyday, and the staff would make cute little animal sculptures with my towels, which always made me smile. Wireless internet access was a must for me, and it was only $7 a day for unlimited access. Also, They hook you up with a cheap ticket for an umbrella and two lounge chairs and a free beach towel to Playa Mamitas, which is the hottest beach in Playa. Everyone was friendly, but Silvano, also at reception, went above and beyond during my stay. He was gracious and informative, and knew instantly the lay of the land, specific to my needs. He was patient with my Spanish skills, and was easy to converse with in both English and Spanish. I felt like I was leaving a family when I checked out, and I wished I could have stayed longer! The location is perfect, only a block and a half away from 5th avenue, and 2 blocks from the beach, and near all of the local clubs, bars, restaurants and shopping. It really is a gem, but like a chameleon, it blends really well with its surroundings, and that is the beauty of it! Hotel Playa del Carmen is a hidden treasure!

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Little Hide-away”
Reviews.Author: Surfsnorkeler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Playa del Karma is a great little hotel in the heart of Playa, yet away from it all. The rooms are well acquainted and the service is exceptional! A very charming place with reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “A home in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: SMILEM88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent if you want to enjoy an intimate and friendly atmosphere with personalized service and luxury. A typical Mexican decoration and own style . The employees are friendly and give us an excellent service. To enjoy the beach you can go the Mamita's Beach Club, and the hotel is near to the 5th Avenue with all the restaurants and the best sites on the beach, Lucky option.

Reviews.Title: “a little pearl in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: kerridwen82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very pretty pearl in playa del carmen. Everyone is kind and disponible. Room are good, even if the walls permit you to hear every step done in the room next to yours. Breakfast is perfect and delicious. Christian and Alessandro will give you any advice you may need to have a trip or anything else in Mexico. It's worth spending some nights there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected - fantastic”
Reviews.Author: alameda73
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this hotel were dead on and we were delighted with the accommodation, service, food and location. Right from the beginning, my girlfriend and I were cordially welcomed by the friendly staff and given the low down on all the amenities that the small hotel offered. Even though the hotel is on a semi-busy street, the warm lobby and lush surroundings of the hotel instantly set a pleasant mood. We traveled with another couple from Australia and we our two rooms were at the end of the small courtyard. We loved seeing a hammock near the front door and the room was simple and clean. The tile, bamboo and thatched roof was very cool and authentic - what I imagined a room in Mexico would be like. The entire staff was fantastic. Everyone was friendly and very helpful. When we decided to travel to Tulum for the day, we weighed several options and one of the managers of the hotel suggested we rent a van for the entire day. It was about $120 US and it was totally worth it. The driver took us to the ruins and then he took us to a very secluded beach that might have been one of the nicest beaches I have ever been to. (And I've traveled all over the world, Asia, Australia, Mediterranean, etc...) The hotel's restaurant upstairs was cute and once again, the staff were all very welcoming and gracious. The coffee was really good and the continental breakfast was a great way to start the day. For a few dollars more we tried the eggs and waffles on different days and the food was fine. The Hotel's location was great. A close enough walk to the main pedestrian area (5th Ave) and we also ventured to Wal-Mart a few blocks away and stocked up on beer, snacks, etc. Our small min-fridge in the room was perfect. Overall, I have to compliment the people that have written such great comments about this hotel because for the most part, they all nailed the place. It's nice to have a forum like this to contribute to. I highly recommend staying at Hotel Del Karma!

Reviews.Title: “A little oasis with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: 2nlight
Reviews.Content: A reasonably-priced, wonderful little tropical oasis, central and close to everything, yet quiet. The staff and managers went above and beyond, to make our stay as comfortable and pleasant as possible. It felt like a family hotel. The rooms are very comfortable, clean and uniquely decorated. Every day, Neli made beautiful animal arrangements out of our towels, well worth taking pictures. Eventhough continental breakfast was included, we decided to add a-la-carte items, because Elizabeth always created something special. Also, don't miss taking advantage of the Sukha Healing Center; we got a couple of great therapy sessions from certified and very knowledgable people. Even though we had a lot of rain, it was a great experience we wouldn't want to miss!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay at the Karma”
Reviews.Author: suzie650
Reviews.Content: Hotel Playa del Karma is all about its people and thanks to the staff, they made our stay memorable. From the maid who created animals with our bath towels everyday; to the smiles on the breakfast girls' faces; to the service provided by Antonello at the Travel office; to the reception staff there to assist 24hrs a day - everyone contributed and made a genuine effort to their guests. It is a charming boutique hotel, close to the main street, beach and bus terminal. Complimentary water available all day and beach towels on demand. I'd recommend the place to anyone who wants simple, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Mariachi Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Mariachi1014
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. It's like a little tropical rain forest. The staff were very very accommodating. We had booked a catamaran cruise on the Wednesday and I had inquired the day before about getting breakfast before the cruise. The morning of the cruise we were handed breakfast to go for two people - very sweet. The pool is small but very nice. It was cool and refreshing, which was perfect for the hot, humid weather. I had read another person's comments about the musty smell in the room. This is true for the rooms with a thatched roof. This did not bother us at all. We were after all, there during the rainy season (and it rained a lot) so there is bound to be a little dampness (smell) here and there. We would stay here again if we were in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice one”
Reviews.Author: sauritto
Reviews.Content: You can come across with any sort of hotel accommodation in PDC ,from 5 stars all inclusive to cheap B&B , but it is very rare that you can experience the warm and relaxed atmosphere that you can find in this little but great hotel. Only the unusual join venture between a genuine Italian management and a holistic Mexican center managed to achieve such an original result. Have a Mayan breakfast, slip on the masseuse bed and wrap yourself in the traditional hammock after a quick swim in the walking distance sea and if, after all these stressing activities you still feel very adventures knock the door of the excursion agency and find something cool to do. In other words if you idea of holiday is like mine one, look no further this is your place. I’ll be back .

Reviews.Title: “A great place to escape from reality”
Reviews.Author: Gr8trouble
Reviews.Content: Don't let the street view decieve you, this place is great and relaxing. Here you get the chance to get away from 5th Ave and just enjoy more traditional Mexico. It is only a short walk from many places to eat and shop. My wife and I took a spur of the moment trip and Hotel Playa Del Karma met our every need. It is just tucked away far enough from everything that you can really enjoy it. Our room was very basic but it was just what we wanted and you couldn't beat the price. The thatched roof made it very unique and sometimes a little louder than expected but no big deal. The staff is excelent and got to know us pretty quickly and took very good care of us. Don't miss the chance to go here when you travel to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Believe all what they write about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lewistheking
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Playa del Carmen and not knowing exactly where to stay (we definitely knew we wanted to avoid the All Inclusive resorts) we rapidly searched a suitable hotel in Playa and this wonderful place appeared under our eyes. We don’t always rely on comments published on the internet but we had to admit that the courtesy, the friendliness (never invading) and the help that the staff of this hotel showed useven before our arrival in Playa is very unlikely to be found anywhere else. From the morning breakfast continuing with the very useful suggestions they gave us on how to get around the area with no risks, provided through their concierge services, to the healing hands of Teresa and Stephan ( innovative Shiatzu therapy and craneo sacral is what we experimented on us), the service is absolutely spotless. The hotel is also very attractive with authentic rooms evoking the village type of accommodation and a small swimming pool where you can meet new friends while sipping a drink from their well stocked minifridge. We can only tell good things about our experience. It is quite a long way for us from Malta but the beauty of Yucatan and the Riviera Maya convinced us we need to go back shortly. Playa del Karma will be once again in our thoughts. Lewis - Malta

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Karma9
Reviews.Content: We spend an amazing 8 days at Playa del Karma. It's a charming and cozy little hotel. The staff helps a lot to make your stay as pleasant as can be. They also have a tour agency (Karma Trails) where we got good advice and didn't have to shop around because their prices are competitive and they looked after us. We heard about bad experiences of people buying tours on Fifth avenue. Overall we highly recommend this hotel because of the location, beauty, service and money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Karma!”
Reviews.Author: anu_g76
Reviews.Content: Just back to sunny London. And so want to go back to Playa Del Carmen! We had an excellent time. We stayed at Hotel Playa Del Karma. And what a great choice it was! We based the decision on the hotel's reviews and we were not dissappointed. The hotel: very intimate and cosy. Quiet (which is just what we needed after a day at the beach), but close to all the action of the lively 5th Avenue. The room: basic but clean and cool (AC in a good order). Big and very comfortable bed! I had the best sleep ever. The garden: excellent! You can hardly remember you are actually in a middle of a busy town. And what a lovely pool (love the evening lights!). The breakfast: simple, but tasty. You have to try the cinnamon coffee! For a little extra you can indulge in fantastic fruit pancakes or filling omelette or scrumbled eggs. The choice is actually bigger, but we tried those three and they were all delicious. The beach: beautiful! Mamitas Beach Club - superb. The best tuna sandwiches ever! Worth the 15min walk. Trips: we went to Chichen Itza. Although the drive was long (2hrs one way) and the transport uncomfortable - it was totally worth it! And last but not least: The service - professional, but relaxed. Very friendly staff always willing to help. Our special big 'Gracias' goes to Mario who is always ready with a good advice and very helpful at all times. A bit of a problem with communication at times (ie. we weren't told that Sunday breakfast is actually not in the hotel), but if happens - they know how to make it up for you. Thanks again for letting me keep the book! It definitely made the long flight quicker. Also: Try Tequila Barrel for food and Bar Fah at Siesta Fiesta Hotel for live music and drinks! Avoid the clubs area (what we called the Sin City) if you are not the 'Benidorm type'!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterGSimpson
Reviews.Content: We had a great family holiday here in May, including in our party our one year old granddaughter. The hotel management went out of their way to help and make our stay a good one. Most reviews mention the breakfasts and we endorse all that is said about how good they are. Our son and daughter-in-law were able to leave the baby's food in their fridge which the staff prepared specially for them. Don't be put off by the outside appearance - we were told that they were intending to freshen it up so it may now be more appealing - once inside it really is quite an oasis of calm in what is a busy resort.. Not sure if the higher grade rooms are worth the extra - their locations are not so good as the basic rooms which are clean, roomy and well looked after. One thing to watch out for is the charging of extras as they may price in Mexican pesos but charge in US dollars at a not very good conversion rate. They did say that they would improve that when questioned. Overall very well worth staying at though

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: scankat
Reviews.Content: I visited the Playa del Karma with my husband on our honeymoon trip. We were looking for a nice little hotel for the first few days of relaxation and Playa del Karma was exactly it. When we arrived my first impression was somewhat disappointing, as the hotel doesn't look that hot on the outside. Once you're in though, it feels like you are living in nature. Vegetation is wild! There are so many trees and flowers everywhere! The hotel location is pretty ok - not too far from the beach, very near 5th avenue, so everything important is within easy reach. The hotel offers two different types of accommodation: regular rooms or palapas (small huts). We went for the palapa. The room was very picturesque and we were welcomed with flowers and fruit. Towels were fashioned like swans, which we found very nice. The room was comfortable with basic furniture, and a nice little porch with a hammock to rest on. My only objection concerning the rooms is that they had this stale smell of mold, which wouldn't go away. The ceiling fan worked very well - the air conditioning was also operating but should definitely be upgraded to a newer model. Generally, the hotel grounds were peaceful and quiet. Breakfast buffet was pretty basic, but we knew that so no problem. There were also extra -plain decent -delicacies one could order from the menu for a surcharge. The personnel were all very friendly and helpful, and we felt really welcome. The pool is really small but it was refreshing enough for a quick dip before dinner. There were some dinner parties at the hotel (once a week), and we had the chance to have a fish dinner there which was really great. The food was excellent and we received extra nice treatment. The hotel offered some spa treatments which i found a little expensive. My husband and i decided we could spoil ourselves a bit so we tried them once - the therapists were very caring and nice, grounds were spotless, therapies on the other hand didn't have any real effect, which means that we could have the same on any 5th avenue parlour for half the price. The great advantage of this particular hotel was that it wasn't near any construction sites (new hotels were being built by the dozen at the time) so we were not disturbed at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulenLindsey
Reviews.Content: We finished our Yucatan-Guatamala tour with 3 nights at Playa del Karma and really enjoyed the friendly atmosphere! The Italian people who run this place are really helpful with everything you need and provide great service with the breakfast buffet and choice on the menu, the free beach-towels, and travel agency. Playa del Karma is a lovely and a very relaxing place with a beautiful garden with a small but wonderful pool, lovely to relax after a day at the beach!! The hospitality in this hotel is great. You will feel like home!!! The rooms are spacious and nice, romantic. The bathroom is colourful and typical Mexican style. The personnel is very kind and assisting in any way they can! We had a wonderful time at Playa del Karma! Kind regards, Paul & Lindsey

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time at Hotel Playa del Karma”
Reviews.Author: Astr7d
Reviews.Content: Hotel Playa del Karma is a very relaxing place. The rooms are spacious and nice, especially the bathroom is colorful and typical mexican style. The personnel is very kind and assisting in any way they can! The only area for improvement is the somewhat `milky` swimming pool. Arnold & Astrid, the Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “Dont try this type of Karma !!”
Reviews.Author: Laredo_TXBolovan
Reviews.Content: ok , me and my fiancee booked three days in this hotel that appeared to be awesome from the internet pictures. Let me just say that they must have hired a real good photographer because the place does not live up to its reviews. The hotel is managed by a couple of italians that always seemed to be eye balling my fiancee and the rooms do not have tv's, the roof is shared therefore even tough the rooms are divided there is an open space on top between rooms. So you can hear everything that is happening next door. The place is colorful but nothing compared to other places nearby or the pictures from teh site. The website is awesome and we were super exited and then terribly dissapointed. I was so mad because we could have stayed in a better situated hotel for the same price. They are a couple of blocks away from 5th avenue but when walking at 4 or 5 in the morning in those streets you do not feel so secure. The place i did not liked. I would recomend for people to stay in the many litlle hotel on the beach or right in 5th avenue such as basico or mosquito blue. You will pay about the same price and will enjoy the playa del carmen experience better. Unless you get a room for 60 dollars a night or less, do not stay here. I know i will not.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: lukie59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June for 3 nights and in my view this is one of the best choices in playa. Especially for this budget! Rooms are pretty basic, but a very descent shower and a proper working AC. Breakfast area in the garden is very nice and above all, all the people who work at the Playa del Karma are very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “We love HPK!”
Reviews.Author: emoneyhoney
Reviews.Content: We stumbled across Hotel Playa del Karma online, and decided to take our chances - and we're glad we did! From the moment we arrived, we felt extremely comfortable and welcome. The rooms are nice, many with palapa roofing. There is a lovely small pool in the serene and lush courtyard area, and tasty home-cooked breakfasts in the morning. The hotel staff are incredibly kind and accommodating. The two managers that we encountered, Guiseppe and Antonello, are extremely helpful and will assist you on planning excursions or just a good place to eat in Playa. I highly recommend this hotel for a casual stay that feels like a home away from home. Thanks again to HPK!

Reviews.Title: “True hospitality”
Reviews.Author: twanv
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Playa del Karma! We finished our Yucatan-trip with 2 nights, and really enjoyed the friendly atmosphere. We had two several rooms (one at the garden and one above the lobby/reception), both really nice with lots of space and big beds! The Italian people who run this place are really helpful with everything you need and provide great service with the breakfast buffet (we loved the mexican eggs in the morning) and free beachtowels. Playa del Karma is a lovely place with a beautiful garden with a small but wonderful pool, lovely to relax after a day at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for our Perfect Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: PenelopeHamilton
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation without our two small children. We were looking for a lot of relaxation, peace and quiet! That's exactly what we found by staying at Hotel Playa del Karma. As soon as we entered the serene lobby, we both took a deep breath and knew we had picked the perfect place for our stay. The entire hotel staff was beyond helpful; every question we had was answered to the fullest with added info. to make our excursions even better. The continental breakfast was yummy and more than adequate - BUT there's no way we could resist Bepe's special creations (from the menu and beyond!!). There's just not a better way to start a day in paradise :) Our palapa room was even better than we anticipated from reading the website - the bed was comfy, the room was always clean and the A/C worked great!! We always had the cenote style pool to ourselves, and after a couple of hours at the beach, it was such a treat to relax in the cool water in the amazingly beautiful garden!! The hotel is located just far enough away from 5th Ave. to ensure quietness and a close walk to the best restaurants and stretches of beach. All in all, our vacation did not have a single second of un-perfectness and Hotel Playa del Karma played a huge role in that. We can't wait to visit the hotel and staff again next summer!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: GCarver
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel - very close to the action on 5th Avenue. Staff were very friendly and willing to help. Very good value for the area. Very clean with huge bathroom. Excellent place to stay in Playa del Carmel

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: runnergirl78
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at hotel playa karma. It's located on a busy street so if you're a light sleeper, the traffic might bother you at night. We did hear the dog a couple of times but was it was only for a few minutes. Overall, I was impressed with their customer service. The staff was very nice and accomodating. Mario was very friendly. We arranged a couple of tours with karma trails and we were happy with the tours we chose. Antonello arranged a breakfast-to-go box before we headed out to one of our tours in the morning and it was abundant, filled with fruits, bread, water and cake. If you prefer a hotel with great customer service, choose hotel playa karma.

Reviews.Title: “JUST GREAT !!”
Reviews.Author: marialBoston
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Super nice staff (great recommendations on local pleces to eat and visit, day trips etc), great location, awesome food. Away from the noisy crowd but close to everything. We will highly reccomend it !!

Reviews.Title: “Put Your Money To Better Use!”
Reviews.Author: JAXtravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nightmare from the start. I made a reservation on a travel website, and upon arrival the Playa Del Karma could not find my reservation. There is NO air-conditioning in the lobby so I was about to have a heat stroke while I waited 45 minutes to find my reservation and get a room. The employees spoke very little English so communication was difficult and annoying. The staff was unhelpful with all aspects of the stay; they were clueless about everything from nearby attractions to local restaurants. The "pool" was about 2 feet deep and hot. The air conditioner in the room was horrible, and they would not replace bathroom towels or amenities even after several request. The continental breakfast is a piece of toast and water. The bottom line is that this place is more of a Hostel than resort. At the end of our stay we found hundreds of dollars of false charges that took HOURS to get to the bottom of. If your going to visit Playa, please spend the little extra $ and stay somewhere worth your while, it will make the trip a whole different experience for the better.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of Paradise in Playa”
Reviews.Author: saubertek
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Karma and it was really fantastic. The staff was very friendly and fun to talk to; the grounds were beautiful; the room was cozy but not squished; and the access to the City of Playa was superb! Be aware: no TV, Radios or Clocks in the rooms! Pros: Fairly Priced Peaceful and Natural surroundings great little breakfast (try the quesadillas) refreshing cenote pool hip, friendly staff Cons: some traffic noise on Saturday morning (its across the street from a church) We tried to book a day trip to Xcaret (AMAZING BTW,) with the "travel desk" and I don't feel like we were given the best offered deal. ($130 pp for the all inclusive package. We walked down to 5th avenue and spent $78 TOTAL all inclusive, but had to sit through a timeshare presentation- it was worth it- didn't get a timeshare though ;) ) The hotel had nothing to do with the timeshare, but I had seen other places in PDC offer the same trip for $110... OVERALL I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL- ITS GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Playa”
Reviews.Author: BBS-Canada
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through Expedia and checked the photos of the Hotel Playa del Karma online. I was very pleased to find the hotel was more beautiful than the photos. The location was perfect for the type of holiday we like.l Just far enough away from the major bussle but close enough to absolutely everything we needed. 5 min. to everywhere. The staff is amazing, helpful and friendly and you feel at home right away. The food is fabulous. The best breakfasts ever. Everything on the menu is great and Friday nights are the best so don't miss out. The dinners we had were exceptional and the service was again fabulous. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet and the hotel itself was an oasis away from the busy streets. The pool is small and refreshing and due to the limited number of rooms we were always alone when swimming which was amazing. Overall this hotel was the perfect choice for our 2 week stay and will definately be our only choice when visiting Playa. Thank-you to all the staff at the Hotel Playa del Karma.

Reviews.Title: “I loved Playa del KARMA!!”
Reviews.Author: Pilarin28
Reviews.Content: the hotel has everything you need, it's very close to the action but in a quiet street, they really treat you like family and personally cater to your needs. I stayed with a friend for 9 days and by the time we left, we loved everybody there. The hotel is very cute, breakfast is personally served by the wonderful chef Beppo. I especially appreciated the helped received by the front desk and the travel office in organizing trips and finding great beaches and cenotes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: LTom391
Reviews.Content: It is nicely located just a couple of blocks away from Avenida 5, where you don't get the noise and traffic but is a short enough walk to all of the action. In between Cancun, Cozumel and Tulum, so you are centrally located to easily see the sites. Room and landscape were clean and charming. And no, the heavy rains do not leak through the palapa roof! Good air conditioning, complemented with a ceiling fan. Fill your water bottles with drinking water at the cooler in the front office. Nicely stocked refrigerator in room, where there is a nominal charge for items. Free ten minutes of internet access at the computer in the front office--pay for additional minutes. Continental breakfast (free) was sufficient, but the omelettes were awesome, as well as the service. And as expected, they provided a hair dryer at my request. Sufficient street parking during the evening. Really close to Wal-Mart, which takes US dollars for your purchase and gives you pesos for change at a very decent rate of exchange. I highly recommend Hotel Playa del Karma!

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: CherryGiirl
Reviews.Content: I will not waste time by telling you what all the other reviewers told you. Let me just say that they were right!!! It was a lovely experience. I smile every time I think of the hotel and its staff. I was tired by the time I got to Playa del Carmen since I had been in Mexico for 6 days already. I did not expect much, but got the best surprise I have had in a long time. I really needed the spiritual peace I found at this hotel. They really do offer "personal" service. I was only sad when I had to leave!!! But you can bet that I will go back. For sure. Cherry, Alabama, USA

Reviews.Title: “Playa del Karma is great!”
Reviews.Author: mattace
Reviews.Content: We turned up off the street following a long and tiring bus ride and were greeted in the most friendly way by Mario, one of the staff at Playa del Karma. Overall, our experience here was great; the hotel is very near the bustle of the main tourist drag in Playa del Karma, but remains quiet and tranquil. It has a lovely pool, which is perfect for chilling in (literally) after a day at the beach and the staff also make excellent breakfasts. We loved our stay here and would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Skogsra2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was sooo great and so much fun! Not a single complaint. If I visit the region again, I will definitely stay at the same place. Easy walking distance to the main shopping area, beautiful pool, etc.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE PLAYA DEL KARMA!!!”
Reviews.Author: whatbeatsleisure
Reviews.Content: I used Trip Advisor to research this hotel and it was just lovely. The staff could not have been more helpful, the breakfast was great everyday, the special dinner Bepe made for the hotel guests was delicious - we had a blast!! In addition, our room was spotlessly clean. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Karma!”
Reviews.Author: Momootje
Reviews.Content: This tiny and cute hotel was recommended to us by a colleague... I also staid with a colleague for 11 nights. The Italian staff is excellent, very friendly and helpfull. The rooms are well equiped, the garden with it's little cenote-like pool is serene. Nothing you would aspect if you stand on the busy road in the front, but this accommodation is quiet and just 2 blocks from 5th Avenue. The continental breakfast on the patio is okay, and every morning you are tempted to order something extra from their delicious and healthy breakfast a la cartemenu. Try the fresh juices!!! The prices are reasonable. On Friday night you can join their 4 course dinner, prepared with love and an Italian touch. Unfortunately I didn't have time to try one of their professional massages or the temascal, but I am sure there will be no complaints about that either! Best place to be in Playa del Carmen!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: WPBturtle
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at Playa del Karma in early April 2008. Even a week later, the memory makes me smile. I will confess that upon checkin, I don't think I could have been much more tired, so I can't tell you much about that, except that due to my exhaustion I could hardly remember my Spanish but still had no trouble with checkin. Location On 15th avenue, between 12th and 14th streets. To get to the 'action' you would walk down 12th or 14th, cross 10th avenue and then get to 5th avenue--the main shopping/restaurant/bar/clubs spot. The beach is one block further east. It probably took us 3-5 minutes to get to 5th avenue. 5th avenue is pedestrian only, so no cars. Although technically you could park 'closer' (if spots are available), once you are at PDK, just walk. Parking Ok to park in "white" painted curbs. Not OK to park next to "yellow" painted curbs. It appears the rule is at least one wheel in "white" makes you in the clear, but we didn't chance it. There is room for perhaps 4 cars on 15th directly across from PDK. We were never so lucky. Take the next right onto 12th and there is parking on both sides of the street (church on your left, school on your right). We almost always found parking here. There was also parking on 14th, west of 15th avenue, about equidistant. Roads Avenues run North and South. Streets run East and West. Most topas were marked. Stoplights have the green light flash to warn you it's about to turn yellow. Yellows are extremely short. The Courtyard and atmosphere Going through the streetfront entrance room leads to a larger courtyard that you would imagine prior to walking in. The courtyard is full of vegetation and a smaller pool. Rooms are on all four sides of the courtyard, but I'm not sure if any guests are given the room above the front desk checkin. Our room was on the "right" side going in, which is a row of single story, palapa thatched roof units with a nice skylight that lets the daylight in, but no one can see in or out. [It's not a skylight that you can watch the clouds through]. In front of each of these palapa units hangs a hammock on your own porch, which I used each evening before dinner. A nice point is that each of the porches has a bamboo-looking fence on each side so when we had neighbors, we didn't have to have them staring at us. From inside the courtyard, even during the main traffic times, it was very quiet. We heard a couple different kinds of birds each morning and evening, and heard church bells each morning from the church catycorner across the street. We found it amusing that the church bells were neither a song nor any particular number of rings--but just ringing for a while. The Room Inside our room, there was a single chest of drawers, an L shaped table, and a dorm-room sized refrigerator filled with 'for sale' drinks and snacks. The room had a 'you-program-the-code' safe to store your valuables, and a 5 foot wide by roughly 12 foot long bathroom that had a walk-in shower (no door) at the end. Even though my wife and I are quite slender, the narrowness made shifting positions in the bathroom a little difficult. [Not that the 2 of us minded, but you couldn't be in a hurry]. It took some time to get hot water, but that's probably b/c our unit was basically in the middle of the line of palapa units, and it was never oh-so-long that I ever thought they ran out. They did not run out of hot water, and it was plenty hot. I could have been happier with a little more water pressure though. The bed was a King size (I think), and I loved it, my back was never sore. My wife thought it was too hard, but we both slept soundly. I saw a complaint on this site about the lighting being too dim. I'll agree it was "dim" compared to a US hotel room, but it was bright enough there would not be any shadows in the room when the lights were on, you could read if you wanted to, and no danger of running into anything. Perhaps the difference is we were in a single bed room....It was very quiet in the room/entire hotel at night. We slept a couple days with the windows open and the first sounds we heard in the morning were the church bells. No dogs barking, no late night parties (and no roosters, thankfully). Breakfast The rooms come with a continental breakfast consisting of: coffee, tea, water, juice, cereal in little boxes with milk, toast, and a little sweetbread (usually chocolate). We got the feeling they wanted us to purchase the reasonably priced for the locale breakfasts, which looked very good. I'm not much of a breakfast person, so I never had one. They quit asking after a few days. Maid Service Overall, I can only give them an excellent rating. They remade the bed each day, gave us new towels wrapped into some shape, replaced the small bottle of water, and wiped down the sink. Everything always looked clean. An added plus was the day someone-whose-name-will-go-unmentioned left the safe open, and the maid left the cash and passports alone. Thanks! I must say I have very good thoughts about that maid. Recommendations We asked the staff for food recommendations after trying to guess a place on our own the first night. After one night of following PDK's advice, we only went to their recommended choices the rest of the week. Most were fantastic, the rest were simply very good. We've never had such good eating at so many different places. All in all, we loved it. Should we return to playa (so many places to see in the world, who knows), I can definitely see us returning to PDK.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: NWUSBeachBums
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place, and off the beaten path. It's clean, quiet, and the staff is very friendly. We enjoyed our visit, would go back, and definitely would recommend if you’re looking to stay in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Playa, a great place to disconnect.”
Reviews.Author: CescoMontreal_Canada
Reviews.Content: What can be said about this fantastic oasis near everything in Playa that as not been said but simply to congratulate Max, Beppo,Giuseppe, Nello and Marlene at the front desk who made my vacation a complete success not only by there professionalism but mainly by the genuine love that they have for there hotel and their guests. You have spoiled me and other establishments could and should take lessons from you. You are doing a very demanding work and have to compose with all sorts of clients and situations but I have to say that you responded with an efficiency that makes me admire you. As for the dog who was suppose to be barking every night and waking up other reviewers it must of left town because I never heard it during the 12 nights I stayed there. As for the breakfast I had the opportunity to sample Beppo and Max cooking .Try the banana pancakes made by the very able and charming Max. To all of you who plan to go to Playa please consider PDK and do not hesitate to contact me. Again Bravo and the best of luck for your future Francesco(Francois)
